loans.name: Christine Achichi

texts.en:
Christine Achichi E. is 31 years old and married to Paul Nabuin. Together they have four children and they live in Napetet on the outskirts of Lodwar town. Christine sells dried fish in the same area and has been in this business for three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 7,000.

This will be Christine's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to increase her stock of dried fish. With the increased income she plans to open a bigger shop in which to sell her product. 

In the future she wants to be able to support her family by providing for their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy dried fish for sale

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Madina has a restaurant business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cups and plates to be used in her restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Madina hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees for her child and also pay house rent. In the future, she hopes to buy a fridge to put in her restaurant.
Madina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her enough time to pay back her loan in installments.

loans.use: To purchase more cups and plates for her restaurant

loans.name: Stefano

texts.en:
Stefano, 53, is a married father of four children who are between the ages of 14 and 25. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and sells his bananas, coffee, maize and beans to the local market. He depends mainly on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family.

Having recently repaid his previous 40,000 Kes loan from Juhudi Kilimo, he has requested a new loan of 40,000 Kes to upgrade his banana farming. The extra income arising from this loan will help improve the living standards of his family. Stefano aspires to acquire a pick-up truck in the future to help in transporting bananas to the market.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana farming.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Норов Азимчон житель Гиссарского района. Ему 33 года. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Азимчон более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: N. Azimjon lives in the Gissar region. He's thirty-three years old, married and has four children. His wife takes care of the family, while Azimjon works as a farmer. He mainly grows vegetables, which he then sells. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rachael has a small retail shop, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.
Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her be self-employed.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en: Rejina,a 35-year-old married mother of four children, all attending school, operates a business selling clothing and shoes.  She is requesting a loan to stock more clothing and shoes to sell. With extra profits from her business, Rejina hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To stock more clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah M. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Shakirah has a salon business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a big dryer and hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and buy clothes for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and add some cosmetics.
Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors.

loans.use: To purchase a big dryer plus hair braids for resale

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Pictured here is Binta B.. The 34-year-old was born in Kabala. She has two children who are attending primary school and her husband is a businessman.  

For 5 years now, Binta has been selling house building materials such as nails, door locks, and paint brushes. Binta is seeking a loan of SLL 5,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her existing stock.

loans.use: To buy home building materials such nails, locks, and paint brushes to add to her business

loans.name: Akmirza

texts.ru: Гульмирзаев Акмирза проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Сын находится в России. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Акмирза имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения скот. Разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области уже четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Akmirza G. lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 51 years old, married and had seven children.  His son is in Russia.  Akmirza's wife is a homemaker.  Akmirza has a secondary education and earns a living by breeding livestock.  He breeds livestock at home and has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sayak's Group

texts.en:
Sayak S., 62, is a member of this group. Ten years ago he sold all his cattle in order to purchase a small grocery store in his neighborhood. He was willing to do that because of his age and his desire for a change of lifestyle. He is a retiree and wanted to live a decent, quiet life in his later years. His children are already grown and live independently. Sayak and his wife say it’s a perfect occupation for them, because it’s close to their house and doesn’t require much physical strength. Nowadays he brings wholesale groceries and consumer goods from the nearest market into his store. He tries to update his selection pretty often in order to satisfy customer needs. 

Sayak also breeds livestock animals for additional income. With the money received from this loan he wants to purchase more  livestock for breeding. 

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul M., 48, is the leader of this group. It’s been 10 years since she and her husband began cultivating land and breeding livestock. They are very thankful that during this time they’ve managed to build a house for the entire family, a place where their four children can feel comfortable. The purpose of this loan request is to purchase additional cattle for further reselling. Nazgul is well-acquainted with the lending rules and pledges to repay the loan on time.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF) a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mairam's Group

texts.en:
Mairam O., a 45-year-old resident of the village of Kochkorka, is married and the mother of four children. Like many other women, five years ago Mairam lost her job and was left with almost no funds for raising her children. She recalls with horror how she had to buy cheap goods in a market and resell them right away at slightly higher prices, earning very little after each long day of work.

But Mairam always had hope for better times. And better times finally came.

Soon Mairam drew upon her inner resources and started a small business retailing cattle supplies. Her valuable experience helped her create ropes, strings and cords for easier and more convenient handling of cattle. Now, several times a week Mairam goes to the neighboring villages offering her ropes to the residents. Since most are cattle breeders, they find Mairam’s products very useful. Her customers say that Mairam’s hand-made ropes are of a much higher quality than those in the market.

Mairam’s oldest son is now 20 years old and helps the family financially by working in a nearby gas station. Mairam is ambitious to promote new ideas and products. She requests a loan from Kiva for purchasing personal needs for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF) a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Mairambubu's Group

texts.en:
These loans are especially important for women, because their number in the labor force is increasing dramatically each year. More and more women are forced by life conditions to sacrifice time with their children at home in order to earn money.

Mairambubu R., 52, is the treasurer of this group. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the village of Kochkorka, an agricultural area with considerable trade. Her other two children already live independently and earn incomes by reselling potatoes. Mairambubu herself used to have a business, which she had to quit because of lack of capital. Now she has opened a small shop by a bus stop. She hopes this strategic location will help her gradually increase her sales. Her products mainly include drinks and snacks, which are often bought by passengers.  Mairambubu’s rent payments are high, so she hopes to attract more customers and achieve more sales through attentive service and lower prices. These humble beginnings will help her secure a good life for her family members. She has already raised enough money to make her children's lives better. Mairambubu really hopes for good returns from this business and believes in success.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience foods

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Pictured here is Adama T.. The 39-year-old was born in a village call Mayoso, in northern Sierra Leone. Adama has six children. Her husband is a college registrar.

For many years now, Adama has been selling locally-produced food stuffs – rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc. She is seeking a loan of SLL 5,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her existing inventory.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Саъдиева Зулфия жительница района Шахритус. Ей 33 года. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети еще учатся в средней школе. Муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Зулфия уже два года как занимается шитьем. У нее имеется ателье, где она и ее ученицы шьют национальные платья. Кредит берет для закупа новой швейной машинки. Она намерена расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zulfiya S. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 33 years old, married and has 5 children.  Her children go to a secondary school.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Zulfiya has been involved in sewing for two years.  She has a sewing salon, where she and her students make national dresses.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine.  She intends to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Hajara has a small retail shop, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and maize flour for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hajara hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies.
Hajara is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Akynai's Group

texts.en:
Small loans can make a big difference in the lives of some people. There’s no such thing as too little help. Help from a person on the other side of the planet may seem unrealistic, but Kiva has proved that it’s real. 

Akynai J., 40, is the treasurer of this group. She spent 20 years of her life raising her children and breeding cattle. Cattle is a valuable asset for a typical Kyrgyz family. It is not only a source of income and fresh milk products, but it is also an inheritance of ancestors’ traditions. Akynai inherited cattle from her mother-in-law, and she has not broken this tradition. When cattle have grown enough, she sells them at a stock yard. Usually she is very successful in selling the cattle because she takes good care of her livestock and has a higher demand than her competitors. Akynai’s husband is abroad earning money for their family, while she stays here with their three children. She also works part-time as a janitor in a local hospital. She hopes to get a loan, which she will spend on new furniture for the house. She wants to make her house, and her family's life, more beautiful.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase furniture

loans.name: Gulinora

texts.ru: Рустамова Гулинора жительница района Кубадиян. Ей 50 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Образование - высшее, педагог. Про профессии проработала 8 лет. На сегодняшний день она занимается птицеводством. Она в основном разводит кур в дальнейшем для продажи. Еще она занимается продажей яиц. В этой области уже 3 года. Целью кредита является покупка корма.
texts.en: Gulinora R. lives in the Qubadiyon district.  She is 50 years old, married and has three children.  She has a higher education, as a teacher.  She worked in that profession for 8 years.  Currently, she is involved in poultry husbandry and primarily breeds chickens for future sale.  Gulinora also sells eggs.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  The goal of this loan is a purchase of feed.

loans.use: Purchase of bird feed

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Women entrepreneurs need more care now, since their role in developing countries is starting to become more equal with the role that males have traditionally played. It’s time to promote women’s interests in the area of business.

Kanyshai B., 24, is the treasurer of this group. She cannot imagine her life without dance and fitness. She believes in the saying “Healthy spirit is in a healthy body.” She owns a fitness club, where she teaches ladies of all ages how to stay fit. The idea of opening this club was her husband's. He is also an experienced businessman. While on maternity leave, she wrote a business plan for a fitness club. Fortunately, her funds managed to cover all of the expenses, including attracting customers, advertising, and equipment. The income from the business was used to purchase a small piece of land where Kanyshai would like to build a shop. She requests a loan to purchase equipment for running. It is the only thing she lacks in the fitness club. Her dream in the future is to build a health club for women. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Margaret Njoki

texts.en:
Margaret has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years. She is 42 years old and married to Simon W.. They have five children.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer, seedlings and to pay for labour.

In the future Margaret hopes to buy more land and to practise large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labour

loans.name: Princilla T.

texts.en: Here is Princilla T. S., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Princilla sells tailoring materials. She has been in this business for 12 years now. She has requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, she will buy more goods to add to her business--threads, zippers, lace, poplins, etc. Princilla was born in Makeni. She is married to a trader, and the couple has three children.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Gulya's Group

texts.en: Gulya T., 31, is the treasurer of this group. Being a loan specialist in a local bank, she is well acquainted with Kiva and admires how many wonderful opportunities this project can give to thousands of entrepreneurs. Gulya is a beginner in the banking sphere, so her salary is not that much yet, but she truly believes in building a successful career in banking. She applied for a loan in order to purchase a washing machine. She’s well aware of all the requirements and promises to repay the loan on time. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Akjol's Group

texts.en: Combining studies with a job can be very challenging for some students. However, life conditions teach them to manage time properly and make it work. Akjol J. U., 20, is a member of this group. He is a resident of a small town, Kadamjai, which is known for the largest antimony (a brittle, metallic element) factory in the country. Akjol is a sophomore in a local university and works in a local retail market of foodstuffs. Life became complicated for Akjol two years ago when his mother, who initially used to run this business, fell ill with a strong disease. Her disease requires constant treatment and bed rest, so Akjol, being the only male in the family, took upon himself the responsibility for the financial stability of the family. Two years in business helped Akjol to learn gradually the best ways of increasing his sales. He orients on customers’ shifts in taste, price of the products and quality. The derived profit is spent on the basic needs of the family and payment for his tuition. The initial start-up capital was 20,000 soms; now it yields him 10,000 soms per month. Akjol is in hopes of getting the loan, because he would spend it on medical treatment for his mother. One of the major dreams of Akjol is to increase the entire capital to 100,000 soms and buy an automobile. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To pay for medical treatment

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Jalia has a business selling shoes, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees and provide for other basic needs at home. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Jalia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en: Aigul A., 51, is the treasurer of this group. She is involved in the production of national items such as clothing, souvenirs and blankets. Now, looking back at how she started and the stages she has gone through, Aigul realizes how far she’s come. Her business made its first steps in 2007, when she just gave birth to her daughter and was trying to figure out how she could make money while staying at home with two kids. Aigul was inspired by her baby girl, for whom she used to knit woolen socks and sweaters. Sitting for long hours in the evenings, she came up with an idea. What if she tried to sell these items? Aigul thought of potential customers and started offering them her goods. Her husband, who works as a driver in a cement producing plant, was amused by his wife’s talent and creativity. Now her production has moved into bigger items. Three years of creativity and hard work have brought brilliant results. The family could afford to build a brand new house with two bedrooms. The revenue is spent partially on family needs and savings, and some of it is invested back in the business. Aigul requests a loan from Kiva to buy materials for sewing tushaks, special Kyrgyz blankets which are ordered as a dowry for brides. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah M. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Norah has a salon business, which she has run for six years. She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.
To help expand her businesses, Norah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids and more fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Norah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique.
Norah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money and deal with people in the community.

loans.use: To purchase hair braids and more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Akbala's Group

texts.en:
The lack of a formal education doesn’t stop our entrepreneurs from getting engaged in business. They believe their skills and life experience are far more relevant than formal education. 

Akbala N., 48, is a member of this group. He’s a resident of the town of Kadamjai in southern Kyrgyzstan. He is divorced and doesn’t have any kids. Akbala operates a repair shop fixing vehicles. He likes his work and is keen to improve it. He wants to start a new life though his perseverance and ambition. Akbala is an eager beaver and strives for a better standard of living. He also helps his aged mother financially. Machinery has always been Akbala’s strong passion. There were times when he dreamed of getting a technological education and opening his own car producing business. But unfortunately, he didn’t have any opportunities for getting an education. He’s been in this business for just two years and already he's become famous among customers and has waiting lists of them. He’s earning 5000 soms a month, but he says his plans for the business will take more than that. Akbala plans to buy spare parts for cars to improve the quality and speed of his services. He says every model of a car needs a unique part and a special approach. 

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 27 years old and married to Winnie O., who owns a salon. They have two children, both of whom go to school. Frederick runs a tailoring shop and has been in business for seven years. His monthly income is Ksh 30,000. He is borrowing a loan of Ksh 44,000, which he will use to buy a new sewing machine and more material.
 
He plans to use the anticipated profit to pay his children's school fees and increase his stock. This is his third loan--he successfully repaid his previous loans. He plans to grow his business and attain financial independence.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Stephen Muiruri

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 27 years old and married to Mary Wanjiru--together they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend. This will be Stephen's first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy sugar, rice and flour in bulk. He will resell them in small quantities.

In the future, Stephen hopes to grow his retail shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and flour in bulk to resell in small quantities.

loans.name: Second Hand Clothing Sellers Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the Second Hand Clothing Sellers group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 1,400,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions. 

Joseph M. B. (left) is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married and has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Joseph M. B. has been a businessman for 13 years now and he sells used clothes. With his share of this loan, he will buy bales of used clothes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes to expand business

loans.name: Annah Wairimu

texts.en:
Annah Wairimu N. is 55 years old, and a single mother with three school-going children. For the past twelve years, she has run a hotel on a rental property.

She learned about KADET LTD from KADET staff during their widespread advertising campaign. This will be her second loan which Annah will use to equip the hotel. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house and educate her children.

Annah hopes to create a good environment and better standard of living for her family. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her objectives if supported financially.

loans.use: To equip the hotel, by buying assorted items like rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
The Committee Damas Trabajadoras of San Ignacio Misiones works in the supply of backyard poultry. They buy the chicks, raise them and sell them. 
With the loan they want to increase resources to boost production and supply more customers.
Mrs Sergia R. is the most experienced in this area. As a child she raised chickens for resale. She believes that with the loan she will be able to buy more chicks and food to care for them until they are ready for sale. The committee hopes to strengthen and grow as a group.

loans.use: Buying broiler chicks

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: A. is currently in the business of selling clothes and shoes. She is 35 years old and divorced with six children who all go to school. She took out a loan to stock more clothes and shoes to sell. A. hopes to build a house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: A. is currently in a business selling retail goods. She is 35 years old and married with five children. Two of her children go to school. A. requested a loan to stock more retail goods to sell. With the extra profits, A. hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married and lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She earns a living by fishing and fish vending.  Her husband Dionisio, 55, is also a fisherman, who works hard to increase their income and develop their businesses.  They have nine children in the ages between 5 and 35 years. Ma. Theresa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the last four loans taken from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Theresa has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  uplifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 that she intends to use for buying fishing nets which should boost her fish vending business. She wants to continue saving up for her children's education in the future. Ma. Teresa is a Dungganon woman who is working hard to fulfill her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and equipment

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is a 32-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  sari-sari (general) store and a bakery. She lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. Through these two businesses, she is gradually making her family economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 10,000. 

Marites is borrowing PHP 11,000 to fund operations of her business venture. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund her business operations

loans.name: Naserian Enole

texts.en:
Naserian Enole T. is 43 years old. She is married and a mother of six children. For the last five years, Naserian has been farming her own piece of land.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan, which she will use to buy farm supplies. She hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Naserian's dream is to educate her children to a higher level and expand her farming. She is a hard working lady who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maureen Nashipae

texts.en:
Maureen Nashipae K. is 26 Years old, married, and a mother of three school-aged children. Maureen is a business lady and she has had her salon business in a rented space for the last four years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in the area. This will be her third loan, which she is planning to spend to equip the salon. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her business by opening more branches.

Maureen's dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses in the future.She is a punctilious lady who is determined to achieve her goals if supported financially.

loans.use: To equip the salon by buying a hair drier and chemicals

loans.name: Perth

texts.en:
Perth is 52 years old, married and has six children between the ages 15 and 30.  Perth makes and sells furniture and enjoys her work.  She has owned her business for two years and employs three people to help her. Her daily work timings are from 8 AM to 6 PM.

Perth will use this loan to purchase more items to sell, hire staff and improve her current facilities.  Perth hopes to make a profit which she plans to keep as savings.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell, hire staff and improve current facilities

loans.name: Naimodu Enole

texts.en:
Naimodu Enole N. is 40 years old. She is a single mother blessed with five children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last seven years now. Naimodu's dream is to educate her children to university level and expand her farming activity. 

Naimodu first learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET where she lives. This will be her third loan. She paid her previous loans well and on time. She plans to spend the entire amount on farm inputs. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en: Hrayr D. is married with two children. The family lives with Hrayr‘s retired mother. While Hrayr’s wife and his mother take care of the children and home, Hrayr, an architect by profession, provides the main income for the whole family. Hrayr started his business in 2007. He trades in lamps and chandeliers and has succeeded due to his natural business skills and ability to meet the demand from clients. With clients’ demands changing toward more modern design, Hrayr requires to bring in new stock and inventory. Since the income from this business supports Hrayr’s whole family it is vital for him to expand the business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: Lamps and chandeliers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 28 years old, a widow with seven children, of which three go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. In the future, Rose hopes to build a house and pay tuition fees for her children with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Epaphrodite

texts.en:
Epaphrodite is 34 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 16.  He has a small, well organised and clean boutique which he has owned for five years.  It is open every day of the week between 6 am and 10 pm.

Epaphrodite will use his loan to purchase new items to sell to try and increase his business.  He would like to save any profits and reinvest them back into his small boutique.

loans.use: To expand the boutique with new items to sell

loans.name: Phylis Akalale

texts.en:
Phylis Alalale E. is a 26-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children. They live in Napetet, on the outskirts of Lodwar. She has been running a retail shop in the area for three years now. Her monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be Phylis's first loan from KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc., for her shop. She is going to plough additional income back into the business. In the future she wants to become a great business lady in Lodwar and also fully meet her needs.

loans.use: To add stock like rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is a happy 34-year-old married woman, who currently cares for two orphans.  She sells common household items such as spoons, plates, cups and other necessary items.  Her store is well organised, clean and packed with things.  She has been working for 10 years and is open from 8 am to 6 pm every day of the week.

Gorette would like to use her loan to purchase more items for her store and expand.  With more profit, she will buy cows and believes this will be the start of a new and better life.

loans.use: To purchase more spoons, cups and other houseware supplies

loans.name: Zuleykha

texts.en: Zuleykha A. is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of one son and two daughters, who are adults. The main source of income for the family comes from a cattle breeding business which Zuleykha has been in since her youth. Zuleykha is very grateful, because her first loan allowed her to increase her cattle breeding business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1200 US from Aqroinvest and Kiva which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Zuleykha and her family are very thankful for the support. In January, 2011, Zuleykha requested a new loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN), which was used to purchase four cows and fodder. This is her second loan. Now the monthly income of her family is around 500 AZN. Zuleykha also has four sheep on her farm for family use. She and her husband are very diligent persons and they further plan to buy 10 hectares of land to expand their cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To purchase four cows and fodder

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine M. has a bakery where she prepares delicious local pastries and cakes, as well as some dishes. Part of the bakery serves as a shop. Lusine’s freshly baked produce attracts more and more customers.  Four people are employed at the bakery, including Lusine’s husband who delivers the pastries. 

To keep up with the proven basic items, as well as with growing customer demands, it is very important for Lusine to purchase a new oven and some machinery for the bakery.  The profit from the bakery is the main source of income for Lusine’s family, with two children studying at University and Lusine’s husband’s retired parents who share the same household.

loans.use: A new oven and some machinery

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis C. is 36 years old and married to Susan C.. They have three children. He runs a retail shop, which has been his business for three years. He earns a monthly income of 28,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and he is applying for his second loan of 20,000 KES. He will purchase inventory for his retail shop. He plans to use the anticipated profit to educate his children and to buy his own plot of land. He hopes to grow his business. After that, he intends to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To puchase inventory

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine K. has been trading in children’s clothing since 2004. A translator by profession, she could not earn sufficient income. She works from a rented trading booth at a busy city market. She has her permanent clientele. 

To bring in new inventory, Hermine has applied for a loan. The income from her business is the main income for her family with two school children.

loans.use: Children's Clothing

loans.name: Miralakbar

texts.en:
A. Miralakbar is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has one son, age 7, to whom he would like to offer a better life and a good education. To realize this dream, Miralakbar works seven days a week and eight to nine hours per day. He earns about $505 every month from his cattle breeding business. He is a diligent person, who started his own cattle breeding business when he was younger, in 1990. 

Miralakbar requested a loan of 2,000 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva. This is his second loan taken from Aqroinvest. Miralakbar has a good client history from repaying his prior loan. With this second loan he bought four more cows to increase his earnings. 

Miralakbar wants to breed more animals and raise his profits, and in this way support a better life for his dear son.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar N.  is married with three children, two of whom are married.  The family is engaged in farming and land cultivation which helps them pay the university fees for their son who is studying in the capital city. 

Although Gohar is a village school teacher and her husband is a village major, the salaries are extremely low, and it is impossible to survive on them. The farming business is the main source of income for their family.

To meet the high demand for lamb, Gohar is planning to purchase sheep to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 39 years old and married with six children.  She sells products in Nyabugogo, a market area in Kigali, Rwanda.  She has had her well-organized store for one year and employs four people to help her.  

Ester will use her loan to improve her facilities and purchase more products to sell like sorghum,rice and beans. She plans to first reinvest any profits, and if possible save some money for the future.

loans.use: To expand  more products to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is currently in a business of selling charcoal. She is 45 years old and a widow with eight children, all of whom go to school. She took out a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. In the future, Anna hopes to construct a house with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, corn, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, soft drinks, sweets and snacks

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old and married with five children who are between 6 and 16 years old.  Joseph is in the business of transportation, which he has been doing for three years.  He currently employs two people.

Joseph plans to use his loan to purchase a small scooter and hire a driver.  He hopes to make enough profit to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy a small scooter

loans.name: Agustina Rufina

texts.es: La señora Agustina es una cliente antigua  y responsable  que paga puntualmente sus cuotas a si mismo trabajaba con el grupo solidario "macarena" en la cual sus compañeras ya no  desean  tener crédito por que les fue bien en su negocio. Sin embargo la señora como se dedicada a la elaboración D. masitas, pasteles y tortas que tiene buenas ventas en su negocio  y el préstamo invertirá para  la compra D.  azúcar, harina, manteca y margarina por mayor. Y su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona D. villa victoria que vive con su nieta D. 21 años a la cual también le ayuda  económicamente  ya que su nieta estudia y la Sra. Le colabora con los gastos que esto le implica, la Sra. Agustina esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Agustina is an old client who is responsible and makes her payments on time.  At the same time, she used to work with the communal bank "Macarena," a bank whose members don't want loans any more because their businesses are going well.  However, Mrs. makes dough, pastries, and cakes and has good sales. The loan would be invested in the purchase of wholesale sugar, flour, lard, and margarine.  Her home is located in a the Villa Victoria area and she lives with her granddaughter, 21, who helps her economically since she is a student and Mrs. helps her with her expenses.  Mrs. Agustina is grateful to the institution for providing support.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale sugar, flour, lard, and margarine.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot Balumyan is single and lives with his father and mother. With a university degree, Ashot is engaged in an agricultural business which is the main source of the family's income. Concerned with the critical state of the economy, Ashot does his best to perpetuate the profit which will help him to build a well-provided life for his future family.

To expand the business Ashot has applied to SEF to purchase two high quality milk cows. Ashot’s dream is to increase the family’s profit and be able to have his own family.

loans.use: To buy two milk cows

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reyna, resiD. en Jucuapa, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 28 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. Hot Dog, vive en casa propia al lado D. sus hijos D. 10 y 6 años D. edad; El negocio fue iniciativa propia, hace 5 años y está ubicado en el centro D. la ciudad, el horario D. ventas es D. 9:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra D. ingredientes como pollo, salchichas, jamón, aderezos y bebidas,  Con esta inversión Reyna estará en mejores condiciones para atender a los clientes, también podrá preparar D. los Hot Dog con todos los ingredientes necesarios.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio fuerte, dedicarse por completo a atenderlo, para que mejore su condición económica y ayuD. a sus hijos a desarrollarse, no solo como personas sino también como profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department.  She is 28 years old and sells hot dogs.  Reyna lives in her own home together with her children who are 10 and 6.  She set up her business on her own initiative 5 years ago.  It is located in the city center and is open from 9.00am to 6.00pm.

Reyna needs a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, sausages, ham, seasoning and drinks.  With this investment, Reyna will be in a better position to serve her customers.  She will also be able to prepare her hot dogs with all the trimmings.

Reyna's aspiration is to have a strong business and to commit herself to it completely so that she can improve her finances and help her children to develop not only as people but also as professionals.

loans.use: To buy chicken, sausages, ham, seasonings and drinks

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 18. Bernadette sells shoes from her store, where she works very hard. Her business is well organized. Bernadette has been in this business for five years. The hours of her business are from 8am to 7pm every day except Sunday. 

Bernadette has requested a loan in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With any profit, Bernadette will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende cervezas y gaseosas, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 1:00 a.m y por medio de esta trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Elena, a member of “HATUN RUMIYOC”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Elena is 51 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She alternated her daily chores with her activity as bar owner: she sells beers and fizzy drinks, and she works form 4 pm to 1 am. Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her children. She would like to enlarge and improve the bar premises. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the wholesale purchase of fizzy drinks and beers.

Elena is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To invest in the wholesale purchase of beers and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Cleofe; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende golosinas,fideos,gaseosas entre otros productos más a la vez la socia también cuenta con un restaurante ambos negocios se encuentran ubicados en su misma casa esto también hace que sea mas fácil que pueda estar al tanto de ambos negocios la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing María Cleofe, a member of “KANTUS”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

María Cleofe is 52 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She runs her own grocery store, where she sells basic supplies such as rice, sugar and milk, as well as sweets, noodles, fizzy drinks and other products. At the same time, she also runs a restaurant. Both activities are located in her house, and this makes it easier for her to follow and be up to date in both activities. She works together with her husband, thus providing for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products for her activities.

María Cleofe is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To buy more products for her activities.

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en:
Oqtay Q. is a 56-year-old man living in Sabirabad. He is married and has three sons aged 23, 22 and 19. Oqtay owns and runs an electrical goods and destined-for-dowry (housewares) store. He mainly sells to the local community. 

Oqtay has been in the trading business for over ten years and earns approximately 500 AZN per month. He successfully repaid a prior loan taken out from AqroInvest. Oqtay is a hard-working man and wants to expand his business and earn more income. For this reason, he requested a new loan of 1,600 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva. He used this loan to diversify his inventory and enlarge his store. Oqtay plans to use all of his profits to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to diversify his inventory and enlarge his store

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi M. is a self-starter trading in bags, hats and gloves. She is an accountant by profession and married with two children. Armenuhi purchases inventory from different distributors, working with them on credit sales. She has longstanding relationships with her suppliers and customers. 

Armenuhi always follows the local demand and knows the latest trends. Currently Armenuhi needs to refresh her stock and purchase some shop assets for better presentation.

loans.use: Buying bags, hats and gloves

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Marta tiene 43 años de edad, reside en Berlín departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, Ella inicio su tienda por sus propios medios hace 12 años, esta tienda es el negocio que le ayuda a cubrir gastos del hogar a través de los ingresos que obtiene, su horario no es fijo ya que la tienda está ubicada en su propia casa.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, frijoles, papel higiénico, gas, dulces y bebidas, esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse activa en el negocio, ya que de toda esta mercadería los clientes le demandan a diario, la ubicación de la tienda es parte favorable para doña Marta, pues vive al frente de un centro escolar, siendo un lugar de mucha afluencia de clientes tanto niños, jóvenes y personas mayores.
Las aspiraciones son con respecto al préstamo, cancelarlo oportunamente; con el negocio pues mantenerlo surtido de toda la mercadería que solicitan los clientes; Con su familia pues trabajar día con día para que sus hijos reciban la educación necesaria que les ayude a superarse.
texts.en:
Marta is 43 years old and she lives in Berlín, in the Usulután department, with her husband and her two children aged 12 and 15. She started her activity by her own means 12 years ago, and this shop helps her cover for the family’s expenses thanks to the incomes she gains. She does not work fixed hours as the shop is located in her own house.
She is requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar, beans, toilet paper, gas, sweets and drinks. This investment will help her keep the shop running, as her customers ask for these products on a daily basis. The shop is a fortunate location for Marta, as she lives in front of a school, a place with high affluence of children, young people and adults.
As far as the loan is concerned, she aims at extinguishing it opportunely; with respect to her activity, she aims at keeping it well supplied with all the products her customers ask for; as for her family, she aims at working every day so that her children can receive the necessary education that will help them do better in life.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, beans, toilet paper, gas, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. tortas y galletas, ella prepara tortas y bocaditos para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños entre otros compromisos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. tortas y bocaditos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como mantequilla, azúcar y harina.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Victoria, a member of “HATUN RUMIYOC”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 57 years old, she is married and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity, the sale of cakes and cookies. She prepares cakes and snacks for different events such as weddings and birthdays among other celebrations. She wishes to enlarge and improve her activity of cakes and snacks sale. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as butter, sugar and flour.

Victoria is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To buy butter, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Yves

texts.en:
Yves is a 25-year-old married man who owns a small shop selling mobile phones. Yves' wife also works and they do not have any children. Yves purchased his business four years ago and chose it because he believed that it would return a solid profit. The store is well-organized and is open from 8 am until 6 pm on weekdays.

This is Yves' first loan and he intends to use the loan to purchase more inventory and hopes to use the profits to eventually become a wholesale seller of mobile phones.

loans.use: Additional inventory of mobile phones

loans.name: Ena Josabeth

texts.es:
Ena reside en Alegría departamento de Usulután, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y una hija de 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender plantas, este negocio lo tiene en su casa hace 5 años, lo atiende de 9:00am a 5:00pm, todos los días de la semana, este negocio se lo enseño su madre.
Por el momento Ena necesita invertir en el negocio, comprar plantas frutales y ornamentales, también semilla,  por lo que solicita un préstamo y con los fondos de este adquirir las plantas que sean necesarias para fortalecer el vivero, también semilla para cultivar diferentes plantas y árboles frutales, esperando que esta inversión le ayude a recibir mejores ingresos para su familia.
Sus sueños y aspiraciones son que a través del crecimiento del vivero sus ventas sean mejores, que su situación económica sea más solvente para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ena lives in Alegría, in Usulután department; she is 29 years old and she lives with her husband and their 7-year-old daughter. She engages in selling plants, an activity she started in her own house 5 years ago. She works there from 9 am to 5 pm every day of the week, and it was her mother who introduced her to this activity.
At the moment, Ena needs to invest in the shop by buying fruit and ornamental plants, as well as seeds. For this reason she is requesting a loan with which to purchase the plants she needs to strengthen the nursery, as well as seeds to grow different plants and fruit trees; she hopes that this investment will help her gaining a better income for her family.
She aims at improving her sales thanks to the growth of her nursery, and she dreams of finding herself in a more respectable economic situation in order to improve her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and ornamental and fruit plants.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aurelia; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo D. periodismo, la socia también es cesante D. educación, por medio D. estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere refaccionar su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción como cemento y ladrillos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Aurelia, a member of “HATUN RUMIYOC”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Aurelia is 60 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her work as a journalist; she is also a retired teacher, and thanks to her activity and her pension she is able to proviD. for her children. She would like to have her house repaired, and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as cement and bricks.

Aurelia is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ceferina; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende golosinas, fideos, gaseosa, aceite y mas la socia está contenta con su negocio ya que mediante este ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Ceferina, a member of “KANTUS”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Ceferina is 42 years old, she lives with her partner and has 3 children. She owns a grocery store where she sells basic supplies such as rice, sugar and milk; she also sells sweets, noodles, fizzy drinks, oil and so on. She is happy with her job, as thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her family. She is a very cheerful person with an activity she is determined to carry on.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her shop, in order to have a wider variety of products to offer.
Ceferina is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Florienne

texts.en:
Florienne is 45 years old and is married with 2 children aged 14 and 18.  She also cares for 2 dependents who are 12 and 13 years old.  Florienne started her banana-selling business because she knew it would be profitable.  She now employs one other person and has been in operation for 3 years.  The shop is open from 6am until 9pm.

Florienne will use her loan to purchase more yellow bananas.  She plans to use the money she makes for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
For 11 years, Anahit A. has been selling food. Anahit rents two shops in one of the busy parts of the city. She works with various grocery distributors on credit sales. As her clients' demands are growing each day, Anahit is willing to increase the assortment of goods in her shop, as well as buy some shop assets to better present her goods.

Anahit is a doctor by profession and living with her son who helps Anahit deliver her goods. Anahit’s husband was killed at the Karabakh war.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Brenda Catherine

texts.es:
Brenda tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y  reside en casa de sus tías en el Condominio Pinos de La Plata un lugar urbano, tranquilo y cerrado ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Brenda trabaja en el Centro de salud de la ciudad de Reque  como técnica enfermera, con más de seis meses laborando como tal. Adicionalmente cuida a personas de la tercera edad brindándoles atención especializada. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad solventa los gastos económicos  personales y ayuda a su madre que vive en Lima.

Ella desea obtener su Titulo de Enfermera Instituto Cayetano Heredia, esta inversión le ayudará a tener estabilidad laboral y lograr sus objetivos profesionales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Brenda es una persona bastante trabajadora y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Brenda is 24 years old, single, and lives with her aunt in the Pinos de la Plata condominium, which is an urban, quiet, and closed place located in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Brenda has worked at the health center in the city of Reque as a nurse for six months.  She also cares for elderly people and gives them special attention.  With the income she earns, she pays her own expenses and helps her mother who lives in Lima.

She wants to obtain her nursing degree at the Cayetano Heredia college.  This investment would help her have job stability and achieve her professional goals.  In order to do this, she has asked for a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

Brenda is a hard-working person and she is respected by her colleagues.  They think she is responsible and has a drive to succeed.

loans.use: Obtain a nursing degree

loans.name: Reina Mariluz

texts.es:
Reina, de 32 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad, residen en San Buena ventura departamento de Usulután, Reina tiene un negocio de granos básicos (maíz, maicillo, frijol, arroz y café), este tiene 2 años de existir, trabaja de lunes a domingos, actualmente necesita comprar más productos y solicita un préstamo para comprarlos, ya que quiere adquirirlos por mayor cantidad para obtener un mejor precio.
Este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda ya que el negocio será capaz de atender la demanda y abastecer las necesidades de los clientes. Su sueño principal es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y culminar en un futuro una carrera universitaria, además de seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Reina, 32 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three children of 10, 8, and 2 years. They live in the San Buena Ventura department of Usulután. Reina has had a business of basic grains (corn, maicillo [millet], beans, rice, and coffee) for two years and works from Monday to Sunday. She currently needs to buy more products and is requesting a loan to buy them as she wants to acquire a larger quantity to get a better price.
This loan will be of a lot of help to her since the business will be capable of meeting the demand and fulfilling the needs of her customers. Her primary dream is for her children to be able to study and complete a university career, as well as to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase corn, millet, beans, rice, and coffee

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manuel Angel; el tiene 64 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos, él tiene una pequeña tienda de fabrica y venta de zapatos, el fabrica para damas, niños y varones, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de zapatos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cueros para fabricar los zapatos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank “HATUN RUMIYOC”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Manuel Angel. He is 64 years old, married and has 7 children. He alternates his daily activities with his shoe sale business. He has a small shoe-making and shoe-sale store. He makes shoes for women, children and men. He works from 7am to 6pm. He wants to grow and improve his shoe-sale business. He is seeking the loan to buy leather to make the shoes.

He is happy because of the loan, and he commits to making his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy leather to make shoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 32 años de edad, casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de colección de kaptus de diferentes tamaños y formas la socia solo vende a coleccionistas de kaptus ella está contenta con este negocio ya que aparte de brindarle satisfacciones económicas también disfruta lo que hace el cuidar estos kaptus, a la vez la socia trabaja para una entidad estatal en el área de ceramoteca, la socia es enfermera de profesión pero por el momento no ejerce. La socia se siente bastante feliz ya que mediante su trabajo y su negocio de kaptus ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más kaptus (semillas) y para la mantención de estas plantas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "KANTUS" communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Margarita is 32 years old, married and has two children.  She has a business collecting different shaped cactus plants which she sells to cactus dealers.  She is very happy with her work which not only provides her with an income but allows her to care for the plants.  She also works in the ceramics exhibit area of a state agency.  She is a nurse by profession but does not practice at this time.  She is very happy that through her work and cactus business she is able to make a living for her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy more cactus seeds and afford to care for the plants.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy cactus seeds and afford maintenance of cactus plants

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 44 años de edad, separada  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de frutas y verduras ,la socia compra para luego distribuirlo en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado ella viaja semanalmente ,la socia viaja para las ferias del sadado y domingo ,a la vez la socia tiene su puesto en el cementerio de huancaro en Cusco ella vende los días que se encuentra en Cusco , de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más fruta, verdura y flores para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank “KANTUS”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Alicia. She is 44 years old, separated and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling fruits and vegetables. She buys them to later distribute them in the city of Puerto Maldonado. She travels weekly. She travels for the Saturday and Sunday markets. She also has her stand in the Huancaro cementary in Cusco.  She sells on the days she is in Cusco. This is how she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy more fruit, vegetables and flowers for her business.

She is happy for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, vegetables and flowers for her businesses

loans.name: Carmen Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta.
