texts.fr: Akossiwa est née à Tsévié et habite  quartier Adidogomé.  Elle est mariée et a  4 enfants à sa charge.  Elle fait le commerce de chaussures d’homme et de la femme. Elle les revend au marché d’Adidogomé et s’approvisionne au grand  marché  de Lomé.  Elle a commencé  en 2000 cette activité et a reçu 2 crédits  qu’elle a  parfaitement   remboursé.    Elle  sollicite un prêt  pour  acheter  20 paires de chaussures d’homme et   25   paires de chaussures  femme.
texts.en: Akossiwa was born in Tsévié and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. She is married and supports four children. She sells shoes for men and women. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and retails the shoes at the market in Adidogomé. She began this activity in 2000 and received so far two loans which she fully repaid on schedule. She applies for a loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes for men and 25 pairs for women.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mateo; el tiene 67 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace un tiempo atrás; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de anticucheria el tiene su local donde vende anticuchos de corazón y carne estos hechos a la parrilla a base de carbón ,su local está abierto de lunes a sábado por las tardes, él socio es quien administra en sociedad con sus dos hijas ,a la vez el socio se dedica a la crianza de animales cuyes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan esta es una pequeña actividad extra que él tiene ya que le dedica más tiempo a la anticucheria.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de anticucheria como carne, aceite, carbón, sal entre otros más. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Mateo belongs to the Communal Bank “Union Fuerza Y Amistad” (Union, Strength, and Friendship), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 67 years old, married, and has seven children but one of them died some time ago. Mateo divides his time between his daily activities and managing an “anticucheria” (a restaurant that serves grilled meats) where he serves skewered hearts and beef that are cooked over charcoal. His establishment is open Monday through Saturday in the afternoons. Mateo manages his business with his two daughters, but he occasionally raises guinea pigs to sell to his customers who request them. This is a small side activity since he spends most of his time at his restaurant. He is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for his restaurant business such as meat, oil, charcoal, salt, and other items.

Mateo is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: Purchase meat, oil, charcoal, salt, and other items

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa de 44 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con un hijo y su esposo, todos trabajan en la familia y contribuyen a los gastos de la casa, doña Rosa comenzó por iniciativa propia a atender los cerdos, a engordarlos, también prepara tamales para vender, no tiene horario fijo, y necesita de un préstamo para comprar cerdos y concentrado.
Este préstamo ella quiere invertirlo en cerdos, pues no tiene muchos por el momento y quiere que su granja sea mayor, espera que ningún cerdo se le enferme pues sería una perdida para ella.
Su aspiración es ampliar la granja, tener un buen número de cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 44 years old and resides in Santa Elena, Department of Usulután. She makes a living by raising pigs. Rosa lives with her son and husband. Everyone in her family works and contributes to the household expenses. Doña Rosa started raising and fattening pigs through her own initiative. She also prepares tamales to sell.

Rosa does not work on a fixed schedule and needs a loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed. She wants to invest in pigs, but does not have much money at the moment for expanding her farm. Rosa hopes that none of her pigs become sick because that would be a loss for her.

Her aspirations include expanding her farm, having a large number of pigs, and improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase pigs & concentrated feed

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: Laureana tiene 46 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Fernando, de 46 años y sus 3 hijos menores de los 4 que tiene en total. Hace más de 5 años Laureana,  realiza diversas actividades para salir adelante. En temporadas de verano  vende raspadillas (hielo con esencia de frutas), en un parque industrial de su distrito y, en las épocas de invierno, vende desayunos, cancha blanca, papa rellena. Siendo así la mas conocida y jovial de este contorno, por lo que tiene muchos clientes. De esta manera  esta trabajadora madre de familia vende de todo e hizo que su negocio le resulte rentable,  con los que pudo educar a sus hijos y enseñarles a trabajar. Por ello, a su segunda hija le gustó el negocio, por lo que le compró su propia carreta y ahora vende como ella y les va muy bien. Por ello Laureana, se siente muy  feliz y, ahora también se ha propuesto comprar otra carreta para su otra hija, quien actualmente le ayuda y, de ese modo deje de preocuparse por ella. Es su 1er crédito que tiene con MFP y,  se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a los integrantes de su grupo, quienes la invitaron a ser parte del crédito, y dice “que con confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente” De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará otra carreta, para que trabaje su hija y se genere sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Laureana is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Fernando, 46, and their 3 minor children of the 4 total they have.  For more than 5 years she has engaged in different activities to get ahead.  In the summer she sells raspadillas (ice with fruit flavors) in an industrial park in her district and in winter she sells breakfasts, white cancha [a type of Andean popcorn made from a special kind of corn called maíz chulpe] and stuffed potatoes.  Since this hard-working mother is the most known and friendly in her neighborhood, she has many customers, making her business successful and profitable.  As a result, she was able to educate her children and teach them  to work.  Her second daughter liked this business so Laureana bought her her own cart and she now sells like her mother.  Thing are going well for her.  Laureana is happy and now wants to buy a cart for her other daughter, who is currently helping her, and this way she won't have to worry about her. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making all her payments as she doesn't want to let down the other members of her communal bank who invited her to take part in this loan.  They says that " they have placed their trust in her and they are sure that she will make her payments on time."  With the loan she is requesting she will buy another cart so that her daughter can work and generate her own income.

loans.use: To purchase a cart so that her daughter can start her own business selling raspadillas

loans.name: Santos Eduvina

texts.es: La señora Santos posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella comenzó con muy pocos productos la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, familiares y público en general, gracias a su esfuerzo, logro establecer el negocio que actualmente posee el cual es una pulpería, es madre de tres hijos las cuales están a su cargo, todas ellas asisten al colegio gracias al apoyo incondicional de la mama , la señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que sus clientes  están demandando diversidad de productos. A pesar de las circunstancias es una persona que quiere salir adelante con su negocio que es el único medio de ingresos que tiene.
texts.en: Santos owns a general store which is based out of her home. She started out with very few products. Most of her customers are neighbors, friends and family members, among others. Thanks to her hard work, she was able to open her current store, which is a general store. She is the mother of three children and all three are under her care. Thanks to their mother's unconditional support, all three of them study at the middle school. Santos has requested this new loan in order to stock up her store as her customers are asking for a variety of different products. Despite the circumstances, she is working towards a better future and the store is her only source of income.

loans.use: Store merchandise

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: Monsieur    Djifa  est  âgée de 30 ans. Il est né  à Lomé et  habite quartier  Adidogomé.   Il exerce comme activité   la vente de carte de recharge et s’approvisionne  à la direction Togocel, Moov et Togotelecom.  Il a commencé l’activité en 2008 et revend les cartes à la douane  d’Adidogomé. Il a employé une  personne qui  l’aide  dans ces tâches.  Il sollicite  un prêt  pour acheter   10 cartes illico Togotelecom, 150 cartes Togocel et 10 cartes Moov.
texts.en: Mr Djifa is 30 years old. He was born in Lomé and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. He sells recharge cards for mobile phones. He gets his supplies at the headquarters of Togocel, Moov and Togotelecom. He began this activity in 2008 and retails the cards at the customs office in Adidogomé. He has hired one employee to help him in his business. He applies for a loan to buy 10 "illico" cards for Togotelecom phones, 150 cards for Togocel phones and 10 cards for Moov phones.

loans.use: To buy recharge cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Ego

texts.es:
Ego es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad,  que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Guaraguaos Bajo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos, los cría en  la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor. Se dedica desde hace diez años al cultivo y comercialización de limón, mango y arroz, él cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar esta ubicados a pocos metros de su casa, luego vende su cosecha a un acopiador. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga del sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Ego desea adquirir alimentos balanceado para sus cerdos ya que la demanda aumenta, además desea comprar también fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ego is a 48-year-old father of three. He lives with his wife and his children in the Guaraguaos Bajo neighborhood of the Tambogrande district. Tambogrande is an agricultural area in the Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

Ego makes his living by raising and selling pigs, which he keeps out back behind his house. Once they have grown to a good size, he sells them to the vendors who often visit the area where he lives. Ego also works as a farmer. He has worked for ten years now growing lemons, mangos and rice. He grows his crops in a field not far from his house then he sells his harvest to a middleman. He uses the income from these activities to financially support his family.

Ego would like to buy well-balanced feed for his pigs as the demand for the pigs is rising. Also, he would like to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. This is why he decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles.

loans.use: Well-balanced feed for his livestock

loans.name: Orlando Arturo

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre dedicado, al trabajo, responsable, con el amor de apoyar siempre  a sus padres. Hoy en día,  labora en una empresa privada, laborando como supervisor de estudios económico, ya que lo han promovido, ya que anteriormente estaba en contabilidad,  logrando mantenerse fijo en la misma empresa.
Atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic ha logrado hacer mejoras  a su casa, lo que ha sido de beneficio para la familia, ha venido trabajando con la institución durante seis ciclos, en donde todos lo ha invertido en la vivienda. Con el crédito anterior cambio el techo, ahora con este nuevo préstamo comenzara un cuarto como segundo piso  elaborado de playsem, lo que comprara materiales como: láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura, para comenzar, siendo posible gracias a  estos financiamientos.
texts.en: Orlando is a dedicated, responsible man with the love and support of his parents always.  Nowadays, he works in a private enterprise as the supervisor of economic studies, since they have promoted him.  Previously he was in accounting, managing to remain in the same business.  Because of the loans from Afodenic he has managed to make improvements to his house, which has been of benefit to the family.. He has been working with the institution during six loan cycles, investing them all in the dwelling.  With the previous loan he replaced the ceiling.  Now with this new loan he will began a room on the second story.  He will buy materials such as sheets of zinc, perlines, and solder to begin, which is possible thanks to this financing.

loans.use: Comprara materiales de construccion para hacer un cuarto de segundo piso.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kofi    est enseignant de profession, mais il a associé la conduite de taxi-moto pour avoir plus de revenus pour satisfaire  sa  famille. Il a commencé  en 2008 et l’exerce dans les zones environnantes  de Lomé.  Il a 2 enfants et est marié. Il a 37 ans et habite quartier kohé.  Il demande un  prêt pour acheter une nouvelle moto.
texts.en: Mr Kofi is a teacher, but he runs also a motorbike taxi business to increase his income and provide for his family. He began in 2008 and works in the surroundings of Lomé. He is married, 37 years old and the father of two children. He lives in the neighborhood of Kohé. He applies for a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: La señora Maria Julia tiene 64 años es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, frijoles y leña por lo que tiene más de 25 años de tener esta actividad, ya que surgió como una alternativa de trabajo para ella y su familia pues no tenía un ingreso mensual para brindar el alimento diario.  Es por medio de Fundación León 2000 que ha logrado obtener estos financiamientos que hacen que su negocio mejore cada día. El sueño de ella es seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. Por lo que el financiamiento es destinado maíz, comal, leña, frijoles entre otros productos que ofrece.
texts.en: Maria Julia is a 64-year-old entrepreneur who really enjoys her work. She makes her living selling tortillas, beans and firewood. She started in this business over 25 years ago in order to provide an alternative source of income for her family since they didn't have any monthly income to cover their daily expenses. Through the Fundación León 2000, she has been able to receive funding and thus improve her business every day. She hopes to continue building her business as it's her only source of income. Maria Julia plans to use this loan to purchase products for her store such as corn, tortillas, firewood and beans, among other items.

loans.use: Store supplies

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive en San Rafael oriente departamento de San Miguel, junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa y medicinas, no tiene horario de ventas y por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, ropa y medicamentos de diferentes clases, con la inversión espera atraer a nuevos clientes y elevar sus ventas.
Sueña con un gran negocio, con muchos clientes y con un mejor vida al lado de su familia, pero sobretodo que sus hijos tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Mario is a 25 year old young man,  He lives in the department of San Miguel Oriente with his wife and two children, ages 6 and 4.  He sells clothing and medicines but doesn’t have sales hours at the moment.  He is requesting the loan to buy merchandise, clothing, and various types of medicine. With the investment, he hopes to attract new customers and increase his sales.  He dreams of having a large business with many customers and a better life with his family.  Above all, however, he wants his children to attend college.

loans.use: To buy clothing and medicine

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Go- Bifo Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of “Go-bifo”, a group of small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the second loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With Kiva/SMT loans, they are able to expand their businesses, earn more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Yeakain S., 30. She was born in Koinadugu district and currently resides in Makeni with her husband and four children, who are in primary school. Yeakain has been selling cooked rice for seven years. With her share of this loan, she will buy ingredients such as rice, palm oil, margarine and tomatoes, in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients in large quantities.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Madame a 2 enfants à nourrir. Pour aider son mari à répondre aux besoins de leurs  enfants, elle fait la vente de pages. Elle est ambulante et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle a déjà  remboursé deux crédits à WAGES.  Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter  8 pagnes  GTP et 6 pagnes  Hitaget. Elle est née à Noépé  et  habite  quartier  Soviépé.
texts.en: Mrs Adjovi S. cares for two children. To help her husband to provide for their children, she sells pagnes, i.e. colorful African cloths. She hawks through the streets and gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé. She has already repaid two loans from the microfinance institution WAGES. She applies for a loan to buy eight rolls of pagnes (GTP style) and six rolls of pagnes (Hitaget style). She was born in Noépé and lives now in the neighborhood of Soviépé.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (colorful African cloths)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gold jewelry.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina es madre de familia tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y su hijo en el Caserio Santa Julia Ibedia Valle de los Incas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de tres años y seis meses. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela  fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su familia y sacarla adelante.

Lina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lina, a 25-year-old mother, is married living with her husband and son in Santa Julia Ibedia, Valle de los Incas, located in Tambogrande district, a farming zone located in Piura province which is in Piura region, over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has a general store installed in her house.  She sells her neighbors all kinds of daily use, first need items and groceries.  The business has been in operation for three years and six months.  She currently has a regular customer base.  Thanks to this activity she’s been able to help her husband support the family.

Lina wants to expand the business buying more merchandise to meet customer demand.  She has, therefore, deemed it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
Don José, de 43 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de ropa y medicina, vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, solamente él trabaja para sostener la familia. El negocio lo inicio hace varios años, unos amigos comerciantes le ayudaron para que entrara al negocio, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertir en ropa y medicinas para vender.
La compra le permitirá incrementar la mercadería y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, logrando crecer como vendedor y en futuro lograr su meta de ser mayorista y ofrecer a su esposa y sus hijos un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
José, 43, lives in San Rafael Orient, San Miguel department.  He sells clothes and medicine.  He lives with his wife and four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 4 years of age.  He’s the only one who works to support the family.

He started the business several years ago.  Some merchant friends helped him get into the business.  He does not have a fixed work schedule and needs a loan to invest in clothes and medicine to sell.

The purchase will allow him to increase merchandise and meet customer demand leading to growth as a salesman and in the future be able to reach his goal of becoming a wholesaler and offering his wife and children a different future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and medicine.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria Lucia T.: de 36 años tiene 2 hijos ella trabaja todos los dias vendiendo en el mercado municipal de su comunidad, ya que tiene que mantener a sus hijos porque estan en epoca escolar, ella vende frutas y berduras por mayor ella dice que nesecita invertir mas para elevar mas su ganacia ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes, espor eso que ella solicita este credito para comprar frutas y berduras por mayor.
Agradece a Dios por haber conocido a fape porque es una institucion que le ha ayudado, sus sueños son tener un local donde vender sus frutas y verduras y tambien ir agregando otra clase de venta como por ejemplo venta de ropa tipica.
texts.en:
María Lucia T., 36, has two children.  She works every day selling in her community’s municipal market because she has to support her children who are school aged.  She sells fruit and vegetables at wholesale.  She says that she needs to invest more in order to increase profits because she has much customer demand.  This is why she is asking for this loan, to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

She thanks God for having known Fape because it’s an institution that has helped her.  Her dreams are to have a locale where she can sell fruit and vegetables and also gradually add other kinds of sales like typical clothing, for example.
.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.en:
Mr. Anibal G. is married and has four older children who are already married and on their own. 

He and his wife put together a small general store in their house, which is located in a highly busy neighborhood.

They first started with a small investment of capital that they were able to came up from working in the past. Anibal also works as a security guard besides running his business.

Thanks to their work they were able to buy all the necessary things for their house and get an education for their children.
 He has proven to be a generous, responsible and honest person in his commitments.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 33 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa arrendada. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a criar animales menores como: cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, y diariamente se dedica del cuidado y alimentación de estos animales. En este trabajo tiene el apoyo de sus hijos, eso le facilita para que ella pueda ocuparse de sus productos cultivados, actividad adicional a la ganadería, ahí siembra maíz y alfalfa, éste último alimento le sirve de forraje indispensables para sus animales. Por otro lado, ocupa su tiempo, trabajando en el municipio de su localidad. Todo esto le permite ganarse los ingresos que necesita, así que cada semana vende cuyes, de esa manera se genera rentas, es por esta razón que desea ampliar su granja y poder criar más animales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes productores y también en la compra de sacos de abono porque sembrará nuevamente alfalfa y maíz.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 33, lives with her two children in a rented house.  For over five years she has been raising small farm animals like: guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  Every day she cares for and feeds these animals.  Her children help her with this work and that makes it easier for her to care for her crops, an activity she has in addition to raising livestock.  She grows corn and alfalfa, the latter serving as indispensable forage for her animals.  On the other hand she also uses her time working for her local municipality.  All of this makes it possible for her to earn the income she needs.  Thus, every week she sells guinea pigs to generate profits and this is why she wants to expand her farm to be able to raise more animals.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help and is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting for it will be very useful for the progress of her economic activity.

She will use the requested loan to buy breeding guinea pigs and sacks of manure because she will once again plant alfalfa and corn.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth Mercedes tiene 49 años, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, de esta forma obtiene nuevos clientes para su negocio. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo ha sido poco a poco que ha comprado una variedad de productos para ofrecer la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad con sus productos, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto. Es por eso que este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisetas y trajes. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Mercedes is 49 years old and has a business selling clothes as a street vendor. By working in this manner, she is able to attract new customers for her business. She has been working on her own for more than ten years. Over time she has gradually been able to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers since they request different items. Ruth is always looking to increase her income. Lately she has had many problems related to the instability of prices for her products.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, T-shirts, and suits. Her dream has always been to expand her business so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, T-shirts, and suits

loans.name: Rosa Indiana

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad,  que reside junto a su esposo e hija en el caserío Chica Alta ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, debido a la calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Rosa ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 22 year old mother who lives with her husband and daughter in the village of Chica Alta, which is located in the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is situated in the province in Piura and more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Rosa has a small store established inside of her home. There she sells different everyday consumer products to her neighbors and customers in the area. These products include basic necessities and groceries. Her business has been well-received because of the quality of products she offers and the good service she provides. With her business, Rosa is able to help her husband with supporting their family financially.

Due to the increased demand she has experienced, Rosa plans to expand her store by acquiring more products. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Rosa is a hardworking woman who is of good character. The people she knows have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Vicente Martin

texts.es: Vecente Martin C.: de 29 años tiene 3 hijos es casado el trabaja todos los dias en su barberia atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes, y asi poder quedar bien con sus clientes, trabaja juntamente con sus trabajadores haciendo cortes de cabello de deferentes estilos, el le da gracias a Dios porque le a hido bien en su negocio a prosperado considerable mente, el solicita el credito para comprar otras maquinas para cortar cabello,y tambien para comprar utencilios para su barberia como por ejemplo: cremas,gelatinas y tintes para el cabello su sueño es poder tener otro local donde poder atender a la clientela y asi mejorar economicamente.
texts.en:
Vicente Martin C. is 29 years old, married, and has three children. He works every day at his barber shop where he provides friendly service to his customers. Vicente gets along well with his customers and partners with his co-workers to provide haircuts in different styles. He thanks God because he has done well and his business has prospered considerably.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy other machines for cutting hair. He will also purchase barber supplies such as hair creams, gels, and dyes. His dream is to open another shop where he can attend to his customers and improve financially.

loans.use: Purchase machines for cutting hair, hair creams, gels, and dyes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, que junto a su esposo y sus hijos desarrollan la misma actividad. Diariamente trabaja, cuidando y fertilizando sus tierras, para que puedan sus productos crecer saludablemente, ya que de ello depende para obtener una excelente cosecha y recuperar la inversión que aporte en esta siembra. Entre los principales productos que cultiva es la quinua, ya que le genera mejores rentas que el cultivo de papa y maíz. Refiere que la quinua es un producto de mucha demanda en su zona, por lo que considera que no tiene pierde y esto la anima a seguir dedicándose a la agricultura con la proyección de adquirir más terrenos de cultivo. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para esta temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has been farming for more than ten years and works with her husband and children in her business. María works every day caring for and fertilizing her land so that her crops can grow properly. She depends on a good harvest so that she can recover the investment from her planting. The main crop she grows is quinoa, since it is more profitable than growing potatoes and corn. She says that quinoa is a product that has high demand in the area, so she does not believe she will experience any losses. María is committed to continue farming and has plans to acquire more farmland.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support and has already demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, María is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She appreciates everyone who approved her loan request because the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in sacks of compost for the planting season.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
EL grupo “LAS PALMERAS “se formo hace 3 años  la Sra. Marciala es parte de el, como socia  ella se siente feliz pues ha visto como su vida ha mejorado antes de ingresar al grupo trabajaba vendiendo medias lo hacia caminando de mercado en mercado y realmente era agotador  pero logro ahorrar algún dinero y decidió montar una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, al principio como todo negocio con muy pocas cosas pero con muchas ganar de trabajar así fue consiguiendo lo que hoy en día tiene, una bodega formal que tiene por nombre “ BODEGA MARTHA”  la que esta surtida de muchos productos vende de todo desde productos de pan llevar  hasta abarrotes ,pollo y también tiene una vitrina donde ofrece algo de ropa  su máximo sueño es seguir creciendo y lograr tener un negocio mucho mas grande, el préstamo que recibirá  será de gran ayuda  por que tiene que cambiar sus vitrinas que se han deteriorado  con el tiempo y el uso con ese dinero comprara sus vitrinas nuevas también algo de  útiles de librería por la época escolar que se avecina, La Sra. Marciala  realmente esta progresando mucho debido al empeño que le pone a cada cosa que hace.

* La Sra Marciala esta vestida con blusa negra.
texts.en:
The group “Las Palmeras” (The Palm Trees) was formed three years ago. Sra. Marciala is part of this group. As a member, she is happy to see how much her life has improved since joining the group. She started working by walking from market to market to sell her goods. The work was quite exhausting, but it enabled her to save some money so that she could open a small grocery store in her home. At first her business had very little, but with much work she was able achieve what she has today. Her store is formally named “Bodega Martha” (Martha’s Grocery Store) and is stocked with many products including bread, groceries, chicken, and other items. She also has a display case from which she offers clothes. Her greatest wish is to continue growing so that she can have a larger business.

The loan she will receive will be a great help so that she can replace her display cases since they have worn out over time. She plans to buy new display cases and some school supplies since the start of the school year is approaching. Sra. Marciala has really made much progress due to the effort she puts in each day.

*Sra. Marciala is the woman wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: Purchase display cases & school supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy corn, lime, firewood, and beans

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es un madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío San Pablo ubicado en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Mariana se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino teniendo actualmente 25 ovinos, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años. Ella cría sus  animales en corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado y mejorar sus corrales para que sus animales tengan buen nivel de desarrollo, de esta manera ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 36 year old mother who lives with her family in the village of San Pablo, which is in the rural district of Tambogrande. This farming area is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Mariana raises sheep and currently has 25 heads of livestock. She has been in this business for three years. Mariana keeps her animals in pens located near her home and feeds them grains and natural grasses. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where she lives.

Mariana wants to acquire balanced feed and improve the pens where the animals are kept so that they can develop properly. She also wants to expand her business and generate better earnings. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can accomplish her goal.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for her sheep

loans.name: Grupo De Amigas Group

texts.en:
This group arose from a presentation made near the neighborhood, and it is now in the third loan cycle. They've been operating since 2010 and they've saved  2,035,349 PYG.

The director is Ms. Elvira P. of Miranda who is married and has six children. Her husband is a tradesman. Elvira works in the selling of clothes around the neighborhood as a peddler with very good results. She says that the loans given by the foundation help her buy more clothes. She is very grateful as thanks to that, she can get more income.

All the women in the group also have productive activities, like hairdressing, selling, cleaning, fruit sales, etc.

loans.use: To buy clothes and underwear for resale

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Angel R. C. is a happily married man with his own house that has all the necessities you'll find in a home. He is a micro-entrepreneur who owns a general store called "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope).

He has been in business for four years, which allows him to have very good clientele and income.

He requested a loan for 4,386,356 PYG to purchase goods, oil, flour, sugar and yerba brought from across the border in Posadas Misiones, Argentina, which allows for the cost go down and profit to go up.

loans.use: To purchase goods, oil, flour, sugar, yerba, etc.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha G. tiene 48 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 20 años  e inició su negocio en compañía de su esposo desde hace 12 años cuando su esposo quedó desempleado y entre los dos decidieron aplicar la liquidación, producto de la terminación del contrato laboral d éste último en su hoy negocio de mercancía,  para continuar sosteniendo su hogar pues hasta ese momento era su único ingreso.
 Así fue que analizando la experiencia de una amiga en la  venta de cosméticos mediante catálogos, decidió invertir en ese propósito y buscó la forma de capitalizar su negocio mediante un trabajo comercial persistente entre ella y su esposo. Así se sostuvo la familia durante algún tiempo con la decisión de su esposo de trabajar independientemente, quien  ayudó a que este negocio se fortaleciera cada día más. Finalmente como necesitaban un capital extra porque eran muchos los pedidos  de sus clientes, decidió organizarse en un grupo solidario, con el cual inició su vida crediticia en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace más de siete años y en los que estuvo,  tres de ellos  unida a sus compañeras de grupo y  3 años de manera individual;  hasta la presente ha recibido 16 créditos con los que ha logrado capitalizar su negocio y generar los ingresos suficientes para sostener el hogar e invertir especialmente  en la educación de sus hijas que en la actualidad cursan carreras universitarias.  Su meta actual es lograr el condicionamiento locativo de su negocio para brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Martha en el futuro se ve dirigiendo una fuerza comercial con la cual logrará la sostenibilidad de su negocio y de su familia. Con su credikiva que es el crédito # 17 comprará ropa, perfumes y cosméticos, con el cual aumentará ligeramente su capital e trabajo y por consiguiente aspira a impactar a su nueva clientela.
texts.en:
Martha G. is 48 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and two children (ages 18 and 20). Twelve years ago, Martha and her husband started a business together after he lost his job. They both applied for unemployment benefits, and as a result, were able to establish the merchandise business that they have today. This enables them to continue maintaining their home since it is their only source of income.

After analyzing the experience of a friend who sells cosmetics through catalogs, Martha decided to invest in this type of business and looked for sources of capital so that she and her husband could continue to work. Her family was able to support itself for some time when her husband made the decision to work independently. He continues to help strengthen her business every day. When she needed additional capital to fulfill the many requests she received from her customers, Martha decided to organize a solidarity group in order to access a loan, which was the beginning of her relationship with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has been with FMSD for over seven years. Martha was part of a solidarity group for three years and has now been working as an individual for three years. Up to this point, she has received sixteen loans that have helped to capitalize her business and generate enough revenue to maintain her home and invest in the education of her daughters who are currently studying for their university degrees. Her goal at the moment is to remodel the location of her business so that her customers will be more comfortable. In the future, Martha hopes to lead a sales force that will maintain her business and likewise support her family. This Kiva loan is her seventeenth, and will be used to buy clothes, perfumes, and cosmetics to slightly increase her capital. She hopes to continue attracting new customers.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamaraneh” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Salamatu T. is the leader of this group. Salamatu is 23 years old and married with one child who is attending primary school. Salamatu sells fish. She has been running this business for four years now. With the help of this loan, Salamatu will invest in her business by buying fish in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy fish in large quantity to add to her stock

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.en:
Ms. Epifania S. E. is a single woman with three older daughters. Two of them are working in Spain and the other one helps her with her business.

Epifania is dedicated to the selling of blankets, sheets, towels, etc., in a small shop she has downtown. She first started years ago with very little merchandise and she was able to grow her business over time.

Today, she has well assorted merchandise and a good clientele. She is a very responsible person eager to improve herself, and she has a jovial, entrepreneur spirit.

There is no doubt that she will achieve all her goals. She has shown herself to be an honest, responsible person in her commitments for which we have to support her in every way possible.

loans.use: To buy blankets, sheets, etc., for resale

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FASS DIOM est créé depuis 09 ans. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elle sont pratiquement de la même génération. Elle partagent le même centre d'intérêts qui est de soutenir leurs maris dans la prise en charge familiale

Madame AMINATA S. à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend de la banane. Elle achète en gros et revend au détail dans son quartier.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges
texts.en:
The Fass Diom solidarity group was created nine years ago. It is composed of six women who live in the same neighborhood and are nearly of the same generation. They share a common goal, which is supporting their husbands with family expenses.

Mrs Aminata S., standing right in the picture, chairs the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She runs a small store, where she sells bananas. She buys them wholesale and then retails them in her neighborhood. Her objective is to provide for her family and help her husband to pay the various household expenses.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Abelino

texts.en:
Mr. Abelino has been married to his wife for several years. They have 4 older children. Together, they've created a general store business in their home, which is located in a very good place in their neighborhood.

At first, they started with little investment capital, that he had saved up working in different places in the past.  Besides his business he has a cassava plantation which also generates income. Thanks to their labor, they were able to build a bigger, more comfortable shop. This helped them increase the sales in their business.

Mr. Abelino has demonstrated to be a very responsible, honest person who keeps all his payments up to date.

loans.use: The buying of merchandise.

loans.name: Las Rayadas Group

texts.es:
Las Rayadas, es un grupo de Credituyo, que puso su nombre debido a que todas son aficionadas al equipo de futbol soccer Rayados de Monterrey. El grupo solidario esta conformado de 6 mujeres, y este es ya su segundo prestamo con la institucion. Una de las señoras del grupo es Rosa Maria P. de 59 años, ella es divorciada y para su sustento cuenta con un puesto de comidas que establece en diferentes mercados dependiendo el dia. En su puesto ella vende comida mexicana variada como mole, arroz, tacos, tamales, burritos y muchos otros platillos. Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio por 8 anos y le gusta mucho estar en mercados ya que cada dia son diferentes los clientes y asi puede llegar a mucha gente. 
La Sra Rosa tiene 6 hijos que ya no dependen de ella por ser mayores de edad y tiene ya muchos nietos. Dos de sus hijos, Cristian Tadeo y Dulce, la ayudan con su negocio, a llevar la mercancia, poner el puesto, y a vender. Ella quiere utilizar este prestamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar una nueva estructura para su puesto y mas lona, esto le permitira que su puesto sea mas estable y mas grande para poder atender a mas clientes. Ella dice que los platillos favoritos de sus clientes son los chiles rellenos, el pollo frito, el arroz y el mole. Su sueño es algun dia poder juntar los ahorros suficientes para tener un restaurante fijo donde pueda vender el mismo tipo de comidas.
texts.en:
“Las Rayadas”, one of the groups with Credituyo, got its name because all of its members are fans of the soccer team “Rayados de Monterrey”. This solidarity group consists of six women and they are already participating in their second loan cycle with Credituyo.

One of the women in the group is Rosa Maria P.. She is 59 years old, divorced, and makes her living by working at a food stand that she sets up at different markets depending on the day of the week. Rosa sells different types of Mexican food from her stand such as mole, rice, tacos, tamales, burritos, and many other dishes. She has been in this business for eight years and enjoys going to the markets each day where different customers and crowds of people arrive. Sra. Rosa has six adult children who are not dependent on her and many grandchildren. Two of her children, Cristian Tadeo and Dulce, help her with her business by bringing goods to her stand and selling the food. Rosa wants to use this loan to expand her business and purchase a new stand and more canvas. A structure that is larger and more stable will enable her to serve more customers. She says that her customers’ favorite dishes are stuffed peppers, fried chicken, rice, and mole. Her dream is to someday have enough savings to have an established restaurant where she can sell all types of food.

loans.use: Acquire a new food stand

loans.name: Audelio

texts.en: Mr. Audelio is married with two school-aged kids. He works as a peddler, selling clothing, such as shirts, pants, jeans and sweaters, in his neighborhood. His business is growing and it generates a good income for him. His wife helps with his business and they are moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and hard work. The business has a large and faithful clientele. Mr. Audelio is a responsible and honest person who is committed to expanding his business venture.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Jose Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo tiene 45 años, es una persona humilde. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería y mercadería en general. El se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras en el mercado más cercano, el tiene sus clientes que le venden sus productos favorables. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio desde muy joven le gusto el comercio y ha trabajado en diferentes actividades pero necesitaba algún negocio que le proporcionara ganancias diarias y es así que decide establecer una pulpería. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y así comprar  productos de consumo diario para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y productos en general. Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio y además mantener su record crediticio.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, 45, is a humble person.  His economic activity is a grocery and general store.  He rises very early to make his purchases at the nearest market.  He has his customers that sell him favorable products.  He’s been in this business for over five years; he’s liked commerce since he was very young and has worked in a variety of jobs but needed a business that would produce daily profits and that’s how he decided to open a grocery store.

He is asking for a working capital loan to invest in daily use items for his grocery store like: rice, oil, beans, sugar and products in general.  His greatest wish is to continue growing in his business and to keep his good credit history.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: El Sr. Leoncio,  ingreso a la institución  el año 2005 con el grupo solidario "los bendecidos" trabajando en ese grupo como seis secuencias siendo un cliente antiguo y sin embargo  sus compañeros por la edad se retiraron del grupo. Y el  permanece con crédito individual demostrando puntualidad en  sus pagos,  es un cliente dedicado al hogar y a la manutención de sus hijos ya que se encuentran en la universidad estudiando dos de sus hijos y los otros en el colegios una persona muy trabajadora su deseo es el de ver a su hijos profesionales y hombres de bien, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leoncio joined the institution in 2005 with the “Los Bendecidos” (The Blessed Ones) communal bank.  He worked in that group for six cycles and was a long standing client.  However, his fellow members dropped out of the group due to age and he remains as an individual borrower making his payments punctually.  He is a client who is devoted to his home and supporting his children two of whom are studying in the university and the others are in high school.

He is a very hard working person who’s wish is to see his children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy fabric, lining and sets of buttons.

loans.name: Cintya Rosana

texts.en:
Ms. Cintya is married with two school-aged children. She works in the soft drink business in downtown Ciudad del Este. Her business is going very well and generating a good income. Her husband and family help with the business and they are moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and hard work.

Today, Ms. Cintya is a successful micro-entrepreneur with a growing number of customers. She is an honest and responsible person who is committed to expanding her business.

loans.use: buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Ms. Rosa is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns a small store in the Km. 7 of Ciudad del Este. Her store has a pretty satisfactory sales ratio, generating a good income. With her husband, and the rest of the family helping, her business is moving forward. There is a lot of sacrifice and hard work.

Today, she is a successful micro-entrepreneur with growing clientele due to her good services. She has demonstrated to be a very honest and responsible person in her commitments, for which we have to give her full support in everything.

loans.use: The purchasing of merchandise for a store.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Ms. Sabina is a widow with two adult sons. She owns a small general store called “Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) that is located insiD. the Ciudad del Este Downtown Market.  Business is going well and her income is good. With the help of her children, Ms. Sabina is moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and hard work. Today, she is a successful micro-entrepreneur with a growing clientele due to her good customer service.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Edith Johana

texts.en:
Edith M. C. is a young, single woman who owns a business selling specialized goods including cosmetics, accessories, perfumes, clothing, and footwear. She has a small store where her products are displayed in an elegant and well-ordered manner allowing her clients to find something to catch their attention and purchase. Edith started this business to pay for college. Her business went so well that she continues to run it, with the understanding that she will have to work to expand and strengthen her shop.

Edith recently opened her first line of credit with Kiva, although this is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use her loan to gradually increase her working capital and knowledge as a small business entrepreneur. She will buy shoes, clothing, and cosmetics for her store. Edith’s immediate goals are to have a bit of everything in her small store; to approach all possible ideas for building her customer base; and to maintain customer loyalty through extending promotions. For Edith, this is how businesses can extend their commercial voices in the market, which is her goal.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and provide working capital

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 41 years-old and has one 24 year-old daughter. She has been selling mantas (colorful traditional blankets used to carry children or other goods) in Ayacucho for 7 years. She sells the blankets at local fairs or in towns in the surrounding area. She will be using her loan of 900 nuevos soles to buy wool to make blankets. 

Adelaida has been a member of FINCA Peru for 8 years, and has participated in the "Pueblo Libre" communal bank for the entire time. She even hosts some of its meetings in her home. She likes the communal bank concept at FINCA and the training that the organization offers to members. In the future, she would like to expand her house and sell her goods out of her home.

loans.use: To buy wool to make traditional blankets

loans.name: Paula Petrona

texts.es:
doña Paula Petrona S. P. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la colonia 7 de mayo de la comunidad de Guasaule y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Paula es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.
Paula cuenta con la ayuda economica de su esposo y juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus hijos.
Paula en sus tiempos libres se dedica a crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia y asi poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
desea comprar mercaderia al por mayor ya que de esta forma consigue precios mas bajos y obtiene mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Paula Petrona S. P. is 46 years old.  She lives in the May 7 neighborhood in the community of Guasaule, and she sells everyday consumables.  She has a store in the house where she lives.

She is the mother of 2 children, who are students in the community public school.

Paula counts on the financial help of her husband, and together they work hard to move forward with their children.

Paula raises chickens and pigs in her free time.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store so that she can provide everything her customers need.  She would like to buy wholesale merchandise, since it's cheaper that way, and she earns more.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, rice, sugar, coffee, lard, oil, churros, flour, eggs, milk, sausages, cheeses, quesillo cheese, bread, crackers, candies, cereal, oats, soups, pastas, spaghetti, pills

loans.name: 18 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento I8 D. MAYO es un banco nuevo  y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 6 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y L. Sra. GUADALUPE es L. presidenta del Banco y  tiene un hijo y elL. se dedica a L. elaboración D. masitas, galletas, pan elL. se dedica a L. repostería en su mismo domicilio y también se dedica a L. venta D. comida los días sábado y domingo, con el préstamo comprara harina, azúcar, por cantidad para L. elaboración D. sus galletas y D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo y L. Sra. MAURA es L. secretaria en el Banco y elL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropas por el catalogo a pedido del cliente a facilitad y con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos, todas las socias están agradecidas con L. institución por el apoyo brindado en L. otorgación del crudito, una D. las socias no se encuentra en L. foto por problemas D. salud.
texts.en:
The “18 D. Mayo” communal bank is a new one.  It has 8 members, 6 women and two men.  The women are merchants selling clothes and other items.

Guadalupe is the bank President.  She has a son and she makes masitas (pastries), cookies and bread.  She is a home-based pastry baker and also sells prepared food on Saturdays and Sundays.  She will use the loan to buy flour and sugar in quantity to make her cookies thus increasing her working capital.

Maura is bank Secretary.  She sells clothing via catalogue on order from customers and with payment plans.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business thus improving her income.

All the members are grateful to the institution for the support provided by granting the loan.  

One of the members does not appear in the photo due to health issues.

loans.use: To buy flour at wholesale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 39 year-old married man living in Tripoli.  He has 6 children. Since 2000, Ibrahim has sold coffee to customers including his friends, relatives, neighbors and foreigners.  He works hard to provide a secure living for his family members. 

To increase his family's income, Ibrahim is planning to buy a bus in order to start a new business.  Ibrahim is requesting this loan from Al Majmoua to  improve his social and financial situation, and he hopes to attain his goals.

loans.use: To buy a bus and start a new business

loans.name: Yancy Mariela

texts.es: Yancy tiene 23 años. La señora tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende por encargos de forma ambulante. Ella inicio con este negocio, con muy pocos productos el esfuerzo y dedicación que realiza es la mejor. Su negocio nace debido a la necesidad de empleo que actualmente acoge a nuestro país. Ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos que le permitirán incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Yancy, 23, has been selling general merchandise for the last three years.  She sells them in an itinerant fashion on order.  She started the business with very few products.  Her effort and dedication is the best.  Her business arose from the need of employment currently affecting our country.  Now she has a wide variety of customers.

The loan will be used to buy larger amounts of merchandise since she currently has quite a few orders that will allow her to increase profits.  Her dream has always been to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia owns a small grocery store in Ayacucho. She is 49 years-old and has 6 grown children. Two of her daughters are also members of FINCA Peru. She has been a member of FINCA for 2 years and appreciates the meetings, training, assistance in raising her children and general support. Amalia will be using her loan to purchase supplies for her grocery store. In the future, she hopes to expand her house.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
doña Juana del Socorro C. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la colonia 7 de mayo de la comunidad de Guasaule, Juana se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Juana se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para alistar a sus hijos y luego abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
junto con su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de arroz, azucar, cafe, pollo, manteca, leche, embutidos, sopas, papel higienico, baterias, candelas, fosforos, gas, huevos, espeguetis, aceite, jabones, pan, galletas. 
desea tener bien surtido su negocio.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que a visto el cambio en su negocio, cada dia que pasa va creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana del Socorro C., 44, lives in the 7 de Mayo neighborhood in the community of Guasaule.  She has a small grocery store installed in her house where she sells basic need items.  She rises daily at 5am to get her children ready and then open the store to tend to her customers.  She also raises chickens.  Together with her husband she works hard to get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, chicken, lard, milk, cured meats, soups, toilet paper, batteries, candles, matches, gas, eggs, pasta, oil, soap, bread and cookies.  She wants to have her store well stocked.  Her goal is to make her business grow.

She commented to us that she is very happy because she’s seen the change in her business; every day that goes by it grows little by little.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yama De Amor 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Maria es una D. los miembros del grupo Yama D. Amor 1, 2, 3 & 4. Su familia está compuesta por 3 hijos y su esposo, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles es cumplir su meta D. tener un buen negocio, que genera buenos ingresos tanto para ella como para su comunidad, sea por medio D. empleos, o por buenos precios.

Maria está muy emocionada D. recibir su 12th préstamo en Esperanza Internacional. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 7 años, el cual inicio cuando el programa D. Esperanza llego a su comunidad. Maria está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. alimentos como arroz, habichuelas, azúcar, vegetales, aceite, y carnes. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas, incorporando mas productos y también para ahorrar. Deseo en un futuro no muy lejano poder lograr su sueño D. poder terminar D. construir su casa, también desea tener buena salud y tener una vida más estable económicamente.

Fotos divididas, para poder mostrar mas rostros, en la foto se muestran las 15 mujeres del prestamo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Yama D. Amor 1, 2, 3 y 4” (Flame of Love 1, 2, 3, & 4) group.  Her family is maD. up of her husband and three children.  Both (mother and father) have educated and raised their children.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to reach her goal of having a good business that generates good income both for her and for her community be it through jobs or good prices.

María is very excited about getting her 12th loan in Esperanza Internacional.  She’s had a business for about 7 years which joined the Esperanza program when it came to the community.  María is planning on investing her new loan in the purchase of foodstuffs like: rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, oil and meats.  She will use her profits to continue investing in her business to improve sales incorporating more products and also to save.  She hopes in a not too distant future to have her dream of building her house come true; she also wants to have good health and a more economically stable life.

Photos are divided in order to show more faces.  In the photo are shown the fifteen women of the loan.

loans.use: For rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, oil and meats.

loans.name: Emilia Antonia

texts.es:
Emilia  es madre de dos hijos, de 33 años de edad, pequeña comerciante de venta de carne y refrescos, iniciando hace tres años para lograr apoyar  a su familia, teniendo el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como albañil.
Siendo una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, que día a día trabaja para lograr el objetivo de poder mejorar su pequeña casa, que es de madera y zinc, lo cual quiere comenzar hacer la estructura de concreto. Para mejor seguridad de su familia y mejores condiciones de vida, por su condición de ingreso hará el comienzo hasta donde den los materiales, en donde será un lapso de largo plazo, pero que junto Afodenic espera lograrlo atreves de los financiamiento.
texts.en: Emilia  is the mother of two children.  She is 33 years of age and has a small business selling meat and refreshments, which she startes three years ago to be able to support her family.  She has the support of her husband who works as a bricklayer.  Being a woman of few economic resources, she works day by day to achieve the objective of being able to improve her small house, which is made of wood and zinc.  She wants to begin to remake the structure of concrete for better security of her family and better living conditions.  Because of her low income she will be given the materials in the beginning, with a long repayment term, but together with Afodenic she expects to manage to handle the financing.

loans.use: To buy materials to build her small house with cement.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La señora Liz es socia  del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos que todavía están a su cargo.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera,  en este trabajo son más conocidos como corredores de madera, lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos hace 3 años.  El trabajo es duro, sin embargo se siente muy satisfecha con los resultados.
trabaja desde muy temprano hasta las nueve o diez de la noche, no tiene una hora fija de regresar a su casa, tiene que trabajar así porque ella es la que mantiene su hogar, porque está separada del  padre de sus hijos.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles comprará una moto  de segunda mano para poder movilizarse, porque el gasto en pasajes es demasiado alto, casi todo el día esta de un lugar a otro.
Puede dejar su casa tranquila porque su hija mayor se encarga de los que aceres de su casa, por esa parte tiene una gran ayuda.
Manuela Ramos ha sido de gran ayuda para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Liz is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Mutually Supportive Women) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She’s 42 years old and has three children still in her care.

She is a lumber merchant, better known in this job as a lumber agent.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  The work is hard.  However, she feels very satisfied with the results she’s had.  She works from very early until nine or ten at night.  She does not have a fixed time to return home.  She has to work like this because she’s the one that supports the household because she’s separated from her children’s father.

She will use this new 1000 new sol loan to buy a second hand motorcycle to get around on because her transportation costs are too high; she spends almost the entire day going from here to there.

She can leave her house with peace of mind because her oldest daughter does the household chores so in this she has great help.

Manuela Ramos has been of great help for her to improve her family’s economic situation.

loans.use: To buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Charly Jannisse

texts.es:
La señora Charly es socia del banco comunal Vecinas unidas, del Distrito calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad.
Tiene 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de celulares, ella se abastece con productos que traen de la frontera con Bolivia, su esposo trabaja como chofer de motocar (transportista).
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 8 celulares chinos, para venderlos acá  en Pucallpa, ella trabaja mayormente con pedidos
Por el impedimento que tiene con la pierna, no puede ir a traer ella misma sino que otra persona se encarga de enviar sus pedidos, de esa manera también ahorra bastante en lo que son pasajes y le sale más a cuenta.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido tener su capital para seguir trabajando, porque por estos días es bien difícil obtener préstamos, los trámites son demasiados engorrosos.
texts.en:
Charly is a member of the “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She’s 33 years old, married and has a minor child.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She sells cellular phones.  She stocks up on products brought from the Bolivian border.  Her husband works as a motorcar driver (transportation).

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 8 Chinese cellular phones to sell in Pucallpa.  She works mostly on order.

Because of the impediment she has on her leg she can’t go herself to pick up the merchandise so someone else takes care of sending her orders.  This way she saves quite a bit on transportation costs and makes more profits.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has been able to have capital to stay in business because these days it’s quite difficult to get loans; the paperwork is quite cumbersome.

loans.use: To buy cellular phones.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas, del Distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores D. edad (independientes).
Ella se dedica a la costura y confección D. prendas D. vestir, gracias a su dedicación trabajo no le falta y con eso puD. solventar sus gastos. 

Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará una maquina industrial, 10 metro D. tela, diferentes colores, 2 conos D. hilos D. remalle, 3 doc. D. cierre, 1 ciento D. botones para pantalón D. diferentes colores, 1 ciento D. botones para camisa.
Isabel trabaja porque eso es lo que ha hecho siempre y le gusta su oficio, por años esta conservando su clientela y tiene para muchos años más.
Gracais a los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos ha ido cambiando D. máquinas para obtener mejor acabado en las prendas que cose.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank Vecinas Unidas of the Calleria district, in Ucayali state.  She is 62 years old, married, and has 5 adult children who live independently.  She is a seamstress and makes clothes.  Since she is a hard worker, she has plenty of work to cover her expenses.  

This new loan for 3,000.00 new soles will be used to purchase an industrial sewing machine, 10 meters of fabric in different colors, 2 cones of thread, 3 dozen zippers, one hundred pants buttons in various colors, and one hundred shirt buttons.  Isabel works because this is what she has always done and she enjoys her traD..  She has had her customers for many years and has many more years ahead of her.  

Thanks to the loans from Manual Ramos she has been changing out her machines to have better finishing details on the clothes she sews.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine, 10 meters of fabric in different colors, 2 cones of thread, 3 dozen zippers, one hundred pants buttons in different colors, one hundred shirt buttons.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es:
Marlín Narváez tiene 43 años y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena en el departamento de Bolívar.  Ella tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 9, 19 y 25 años que son inspiración para trabajar y sacarlos adelante. Cuando inició un negocio lo hizo vendiendo prendas de oro, a las que gradualmente  adicionó ropa  y electrodomésticos menores que traía de Maicao, un municipio fronterizo y también compraba en la ciudad de Barranquilla así fue como construyó su principal capital;   en la actualidad vende productos de acuerdo a la temporada, así es como en temporada escolar vende lápices, cuadernos, útiles y papelería , en la época navideña , adornos, ropa cosmético calzado, en las fiestas novembrinas todo lo que compra la gente para las fiestas ; así es que ella  distribuye toda clase de mercancía variada en una moto,  entre todos su clientes que viven en los diferentes barrios de la ciudad de Cartagena,  donde se encuentra su principal mercado y también adecuó una   vitrina, en un espacio de su vivienda,  que progresivamente  se  convirtió en una variedad donde sus clientes,  entre vecinos amigos y familiares se acercan para comprar los productos que allí exhibe.  
Cuando inició con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, trabajó en la modalidad de grupo solidario y gradualmente,  cuando ya estuvo preparada decidió obtener financiamiento ella sola. De esta manera logró acceder a  tres créditos en la modalidad de grupo y dos de manera individual; este es su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también el primero que hace mediante el fondo de Kiva, con el cual planea comprar papelería, ropa cosméticos y calzado. Su sueño es tener una casa  propia,  lo cual es su gran desafío,  porque tiene como misión, apoyar la educación profesional de sus hijos y mejorarles sus condiciones de vida. Así Marlín Narváez una excelente madre,  cada día que pasa trabaja arduamente y con un gran entusiasmo,  pensando en apoyar la construcción de un futuro  prometedor para sus hijos .
texts.en:
Marlín Narváez is 43 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena, Bolívar state.  She has three children aged 9, 19, and 25, who inspire her to work and help them get ahead.  When she started a business she was selling gold jewelry.  She gradually added clothing and small appliances which she brought from Maicao, a border town, and also from the city of Barranquilla.  That is how she built up her initial capital. She now sells products that change with the season, for example during the school year she sells pencils, notebooks, other supplies and paper products.  During Christmas, she sells ornaments, clothes, cosmetics, and footwear.  In the November festivals she sells everything people buy for the festivities.  She delivers all types of merchandise on a motorbike to her customers who live in the different neighborhoods of the city of Cartagena, her primary market.  She also set up a window in her home for sales, which over time became a small shop where her clients, neighborhood friends and family, come to purchase the items she has on display. 

When she joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she was part of a lending group, and over time, when she was ready, she decided to take out a loan on her own.  In this way she has been able to request 3 loans as part of a group and 2 loans individually.  This is her 5th loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and the first through Kiva.  She will use the loan to purchase paper goods, clothes, cosmetics, and footwear.  

Her dream is to have her own home, which is a great challenge, because her mission is to support her children in their education to become professionals and improve their living conditions.  Marlín Narváez, an excellent mother, works hard every day and with great enthusiasm, thinking about building a promising future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase paper goods, clothing, cosmetics, and footwear

loans.name: Diana Roxana

texts.es:
La señorita Diana, es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, éstos préstamos le han servido para poder aumentar su capital.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, productos como Esika y otros, le va muy bien porque sus clientes son puntuales con sus pagos.  Acaba de terminar la carrera de educación y está en busca de trabajo, pero seguirá con su negocio.
