loans.use: For home improvement and to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Hedil Roberto

texts.es:
Hedil tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside  junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de diez  años, él siembra mango, maracuyá, limón y cacao en un pequeño terreno de cultivo, cerca a su casa, el conoce muy bien esta actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Con los ingresos que  percibe solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

Hedil desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de mango, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Hedil es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hedil is 35 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and their 3 children in the rural Guaraguaos Alto settlement, located in the Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area that is located in Piura province in the region of the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Hedil has been a farmer for more than 10 years.  He cultivates mangoes, maracuyas, lemons and cocoa in a small plot of land near his house.  He is very familiar with this line of work, since his father taught it to him.  With the income he earns he covers the family's expenses.

Hedil wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his mango crops.  In this way he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  To do this, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles.

Hedil is a person who is quite calm and responsible.  His main desire is to be able to grow as a businessman and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements and to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Adrian Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Adrian Emilio B. labora en el municipio de Granada, del Departamento de Granada en una empresa ubicada en el mismo sector desempeñándose como lector de medidores. Es casado y dependen cinco personas, con este ingreso que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos este señor quiere realizar un mejoramiento en su casa y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para obtener un financiamiento y lograr cumplir sus sueños y así también darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Adrian Emilio B. works in a business in the municipality of Granada, in the department of Granada. He works as a meter reader. He is married and there are five people that depend on his income to get ahead in life.

Currently, he would like to realize improvements on his house and for that reason he visits the CEPRODEL offices to obtain funding and to be able to fulfill his dreams. This way, he will also be able to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Improvement of housing.

loans.name: Roderich Manuel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Roderich Manuel M. P., el cual tiene 3 años de laborar como Lector de medidores en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es casado solo depende tres personas, su esposa y dos hijos que están en edad escolar.

Su gran sueño es la adquisición de una computadora (laptop) por este motivo ahora dicho señor visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito y de esta forma dar por cumplido su sueño.

Considera que esta es una herramienta buena ya que le servirá en un futuro a sus hijos que van creciendo y se van desarrollando su intelecto por medio del Colegio ya que es un centro de aprendizaje para toda la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Roderich Manuel M. P. has worked as a Meter Reader for a firm located in the town of Granada, Granada department for three years.  He’s married and has three dependents: his wife and two school age children.

His great wish is the acquisition of a laptop computer and that’s the reason for his visiting CEPRODEL’s offices: to get a loan and make this dream come true.

He considers this to be a good tool that will serve his children in the future as they grow up and their intellect develops through school since it’s a life-long learning process.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Adolfo Armando

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Adolfo Armando Dominguez L., el cual tiene 2 años de laborar como Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado solo depende cinco personas, su esposa y cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento.

Este señor quiere darle un techo digno a su familia por esa razón quiere cumplir sus sueños con el mejoramiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Adolfo Armando D. L. has worked as a Plumber for a firm located in the town of Granada, Granada department.  He has five dependents: his wife and four school age children.

He needs to do some home improvements and visited CEPRODEL’s offices for this end.  He wants to provide a decent roof over his family and this is why he wants to reach his goal of home improvement.

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor José Ramón A. L. , el cual tiene 3 años de laborar como Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado solo depende cuatro personas del cual está compuesto su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento, considera que de esta forma estará dándole un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
José Ramón A. L. works in the municipality of Granada, located in the department of Granada. He has been working for three years as a plumber in a business located in this zone. He is married, with four people making up his family unit. 

Currently, he needs to realize the improvement of the house in which he resides and for this reason he visits the offices of CEPRODEL to be able to realize this improvement. He believes that in this manner he will be giving his family a decent home because he wants them to grow up healthy.

loans.use: Housing improvement.

loans.name: Brígido Agustín

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Brígido Agustín B. R. , el cual tiene 3 años de laborar como Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es casado solo depende tres personas del cual está compuesto su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento, considera que de esta forma estará dándole un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Brígido Agustín B. R. has worked as a Plumber for a firm located in the town of Granada, Granada department for three years.  He’s married and has three dependents that are his nuclear family.

He needs to do some home improvements so visits CEPRODEL’s offices to carry them out.  He considers this is a way of providing a decent home for him family since he wants them to grow healthfully.

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay off debts.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has been living with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 16 years in Kasur, a small Pakistani city known for its tanneries industry. The mother of two sons and two daughters, all enrolled in a local school and getting their education, Mussarat knows the value of education very well. She couldn’t complete her education due to the poor financial conditions of her parents, but she wants her children to become successful in their lives by getting a quality education.

Her husband, F. H., makes a local food called Poura, a kind of sweet that is very popular among children. He sells it to various sweetmeat shops in the market and also to many areas of the community on his cycle. In business for the past 12 years, he has maintained a good clientele base. Mussarat herself is a housewife, preferring to stay at home to complete her household works, but in her spare time she also supports her husband by preparing the sweet item.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business to enable him to buy sugar, cooking oil, and flour in bulk quantity to fulfill larger orders on time. She is hopeful that this investment will help her husband complete the orders and make extra income.

Mussarat is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this will be her third loan. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mussarat.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil and flour for food-selling business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a transportation (tricycle) business. Her husband Vicente, who is 63 years old, drives the tricycle to help his wife in earning a living for their family. They have three children who are 15 to 24 years old. Marina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 12000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to pay the annual registration of their existing tricycle and buy a new tricycle so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and house repairs. Marina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jije Grace

texts.en:
Jije Grace is a single woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and ready-to-wear clothing businesses. Jije Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jije Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14000, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use to purchase more fishing nets and ready-to-wear inventory so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and house repair. Jije Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). loans.use: Purchase of fishing net

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 de 10 meses, que aun dependen de ella.

Rosa, a la edad que tiene; se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar, hace varios años que viene dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa en un espacio amplio y acondicionado, donde a diario atiende a sus clientes; con el carisma que le caracteriza. Rosa, anteriormente trabajaba en una tienda de ropas, con sus ahorros y el apoyo de su esposo implemento poco a poco su negocio, comprando lo básico para el ama de casa como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, leche en cajas, así empezó vendiendo y fue sobresaliendo, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar, cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas de todos los sabores, golosinas en diferentes variedades, shampoo en diferentes marcas,  bebidas gasificadas de diferentes tamaños y marcas, y productos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de salir siempre adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su pequeño negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Esmeralda” (Emerald) communal bank in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department.  She has a live-in partner, is 42 years old and mother of two children one of whom is 10 months old and in her care.

At Rosa’s age she feels very much like working.  For several years she’s been selling groceries from home in a spacious, well equipped space where she tends to customers daily with her characteristic charisma.  Rosa used to work at a clothing store but used her savings and help from her husband to gradually set up her business buying the basic things housewives need like sacks of rice and sugar and cases of milk.  She started selling like this and started to stand out with much effort and dedication.  She’s currently in the same business, is very well known and liked by her customers who come by daily to buy; she stocks everything a housewife needs.

She will use this 2000 new sol loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar, cookies of all flavors, several varieties of snacks, different brands of shampoo, carbonated soft drinks in various sizes and brands and personal hygiene products to continue to provide better service to her customers.

Rosita, as she is affectionately called, feels like a woman fulfilled, with more desire to get ahead always.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her little business as well as other women who need help too.

loans.use: She will buy groceries to increase stock.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is a married woman who lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Segundo, who is 30 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have four children who are 1 to 6 years old. Ma. Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Daisy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 8,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to buy additional products to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Ma. Daisy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a 31-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15000. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 20000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rhodora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a married woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Sari-sari (general)store, rice retailer and sugar cane businesses. Her husband Ramonito, who is 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 27 to 32 years old. Natividad joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Natividad has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 8000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her Sari-sari Store so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and improve her family's living conditions. Natividad is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and by selling coconut wine. Her husband Julius, who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between the ages of 3 and 9. 

Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more inventory to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future well-being of her family. She also intends to continue to save in order to send her children to good schools when they go to college. Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman. She is 49 years old. Daisy is married and has 14 adult children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. She also sells coconuts and medicinal products for ointments. Daisy has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Daisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like medicinal wines and ointments. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Teresita is widowed and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita sells seafood products, including fish like sardines, milk fish, and mackerel, in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like sardines and salmon. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Paulina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Paulina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Paulina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza U. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and married with five school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a service-based business that provides motorcycle and vans repair services to local community members. This picture shows her husband, who is the main serviceman, and her son who helps them in their business. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

Liza joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided by her business. Liza is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase needed tools. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.

To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. He is also making and selling cocoa powder or bars. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo B. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Camelo owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish like dilis and bolinao in the local community. Camelo has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Camelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Camelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Camelo is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Camelo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and do the household work. She is a very good wife and mother. She works hard to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband, M. S., has a fruit shop in the market. Nazeeran has three sons; two of them support their father in his fruit-selling business while the youngest is studying in class 10th. 

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially support her husband who wants to buy seasonal fruits to offer better quality and fresh fruits to his customers. He is doing this business for some time now and Nazeeran is very confident that an investment will help him to further expand the business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In the previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She belongs to Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a small colony named Tariq with her family in a two-room brick house.

loans.use: Buy fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Batool's Group

texts.en:
Batool belongs to Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She lives there in the small colony named Tariq with her family in a two-room brick house for past many years. 

She is 56 years old and is married to A. R.. They have three sons, one of whom does embroidery work to financially contribute to the family. 
Batool's husband has a business of selling vegetables. His shop is located in the market and he is well known in the area for selling fresh quality vegetables. Batool is a homemaker and a very good administrator. She manages her household expenses very well and manages her household work by staying at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her elder son’s business of embroidery. With the loan, he will purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk that will help him in completing orders on time and will allow him to produce better quality embroidered clothes. 

He is operating this business for past eight years and Batool is very hopeful that her son’s business will be expanded further after buying embroidery material in bulk with the loan. Batool is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In the previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Buy embroidered material for embroidery business

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela belongs to Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has lived in the area of Jamatpura with her family in a single room house for the past eight years. She lives there in a combine family system along with her brother in law who has a business of embroidery.

Shakeela  is 36 years old, and is married to A. Q.. They have a seven-year old daughter who is studying in Class 4. Shakeela is a very supportive lady, who operates a business of selling cosmetics and artificial jewelry. Most of her clients are located in her community and she makes good sales every month due to good quality of her products. She started this business four years ago to support her family financially. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her business. With the loan, she will buy cosmetics and jewelry in bulk to offer better variety to her clients. She is hopeful that by doing this she will make more sales and income. She is confident about the future growth of her business. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
For the past nine years, Adjoa O. Comfort Obeng has been selling banku, which she prepares and cooks. Banku is a staple in Ghana, made from maize and cassava dough, and is usually accompanied by either any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, or hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind. Adjoa sells her banku in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast.  

She is married to a farmer and they have 6 children. Her income helps pay their children’s school fees and the family’s utility bills. Adjoa needs GHC200 loan to buy more maize, cassava and other ingredients to expand her business.

loans.use: Adjoa needs GHC200 loan to buy more maize, cassava and other ingredients to expand her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama O. is a divorced fish seller from Dompoase, near Elmina, Cape Coast. She has been selling smoked fish and salted dried fish for the past 10 years and needs a GHC 200 loan to expand her sales. She will use the loan to buy more dried salted fish to sell.

loans.use: Buy more dried salted fish to sell

loans.name: Efua Nomaba Doma

texts.en:
Efua Nomaba Doma M. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past eight years, Efua has been selling banku (a staple made from fermented cassava and maize dough) and waakye (a traditional rice dish cooked with beans, usually accompanied by pepper or tomato-based sauce and fish) at Dompoase near Elmina. She uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills.

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase more maize, rice and beans to cook and sell. She plans to reinvest her profits into her business so that it can expand.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice and beans

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa M. is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past five years, Abenawa has been selling food products, including corn, in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. The income she earns from her business helps pay for the children’s school fees and household utility bills. 

Abenawa will use her loan to expand her business by increasing the sale of corn and expanding the variety of food products she sells. Abenawa would like to reinvest her profits into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and expand business

loans.name: Patience Arthur Abena

texts.en: Patience Arthur Abena P. is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. Patience has a clothing store in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She has completed her senior high school education and has been in this business for the past five years. She uses her earnings to pay for her children’s education and contribute to the household expenses. Patience aspires to grow her business to support her family and she needs a loan to help her do so. Her loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. For the past twelve years, Batsuh and his family have lived in their own house. His older daughter goes to university and his younger daughter attends the local middle school. 

Since 1999, Batsuh and his wife have operated a meat trading business. In August of 2010, Batsuh began to work as a driver in a military unit. His wife continues the meat trading business and, when he is able, Batsuh helps his wife. In the beginning, their working capital was 300,000 MNT. Currently, their working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Batsuh is a hardworking person and he is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wholesale goat meat to sell in the spring months.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale goat meat

loans.name: Las Mercedes I Group

texts.en:
The “Las Mercedes I” group is now in its eleventh loan cycle. It was started with the contact of one group member with Fundación Paraguaya. The group has been working with the loan foundation since 2009 and has managed to save 2,701,441 PYG.  

The group’s senior director is Ms. Josefina C.. She is married with two children and her husband is a public employee. For the past several years, Josefina has run a small general store in her house. She says that the credit given by the foundation helped her to buy merchandise for her store and she is very thankful to Fundación Paraguaya because she earns more income from her business now. All the women from this group are engaged in productive activities such as clothing sales, tailoring, etc.

loans.use: for group members to buy food, clothing, cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.en: This group came about thanks to promotions in the neighbourhood. It is currently in its eleventh loan cycle and has been working with the foundation since 2007. The group has borrowed Gs 4,081,594. The group's senior director is Ms Maria Perla Y.. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a tradesman. She works as a seamstress and has a small shop in the city. Ms Maria says that the credit given by the foundation is used to buy yarn and fabric for her business. She is very grateful that she is able to get more income for her and her family thanks to the loans. All of the other women from the group also have productive activities such as a general store, food sales, clothing sales etc.

loans.use: Purchasing yarn and fabric for a sewing business

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.en:
Former member of the San Francisco committee, Ms Eda Espinola, took action to create this committee. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in their community. The committee is called "Mujeres Alegres" and is starting its first cycle with 16 members. It's a group that is known for its shared responsibility and caring membership.
Ms Faustina Gil has a small general store alongside her house where she tries to sell the basic necessities for her neighbors. Her wish is to increase the quantity of her merchandise. So she is asking for a loan to buy a variety of top quality products. The women are requesting a loan of Gs 500,000 in order to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
For the creation of the committee, Ms. Idolvina contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee. She lives in Ciudad del Este and she is into poultry. She is very eager to upgrade her business. She wants to increase her merchandise quantity, thus increasing her income.

The committee is names "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Working Women), and it has 18 very active members who live in the same area. They each have different activities to earn a salary. The credit will help them buy the necessary sales merchandise for their businesses.

loans.use: The buying of chickens.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
For the creation of this committee, Ms. Fulbia B. contacted her neighbors and friends and formed the committee. Ms. Fulbia is in the sewing business.  She has had a small shop for several years, which has allowed her to build up faithful clientele and a steady income. Like all of the other micro-entrepreneurs, Mrs. B. looks forward to increase her income and to grow her business.

The committee is names "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women), and its going through its 2nd loan cycle. With 17 members, this is a group that highlights the neighborhood for the good treatment and solidarity they have amongst them. Each member of the group has a different activity of her own. The women are cashing Paraguay Guaranies (PYG) 500,000 to 700,000 towards the purchase of necessary products for each one of their businesses.

loans.use: For the buying of fabric, needles and cloth.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
Ms. Mirian I. contacted her neighbors and friends to form this committee in the area. Ms. Mirian has been selling food for many years now. With time she has been able to increase, little by little, her income and her product diversity. She would like to increase her business by adding more products to her repertory. She hopes that will help her increase her income in a substantial way.

The committee is called "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women). They are in their 2nd loan cycle, and with 16 members the group highlights the neighborhood for their community work (charity, etc.). Each one of the members of the committee has a different activity and are in the working field earning a salary.  The women are cashing a Paraguay Guaranies (PYG) 300,000 to 900,000 credit to buy goods for subsequent sale.

loans.use: The buying of fruits, vegetables, oil and flour.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to a former member, Ms. Silvina Cañete. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in the area. The committee's name is "Santa Catalina", and they are currently in their seventh cycle. With 13 members, it is a group that is highlighted in the community for its commitment to responsibilities and way of work. The members of the committee have different activities and they try hard every day to improve income for their families. The women are borrowing 1,200,000; 1,100,000; 1,000,000; 700,000 and 500,000 guarani (PYG) to buy merchandise for subsequent sale.

Ms. Eulogia A. has a small fruit stand and she is well known in her community for her good quality service and good merchandise. Although she has a good income, she wishes to increase it by diversifying her products and improving quantity.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sebastiana L. contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar esta comisión en la zona. La Sra. Sebastiana tiene un pequeño puesto D. hamburguesas en el centro. En los últimos años ha tenido un número considerable D. clientes, por ello trata cada vez más D. darles un agradable ambiente en su negocio. Ella está ansiosa por tener una oportunidad D. hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
El comité se denomina "Mujeres Virtuosas", con 15 miembros. Es un grupo que se destaca en la comunidad por ser muy unidas y tener un espíritu emprendedor. Las damas están cobrando el crédito para la compra D. mercaderías comestibles para su posterior venta (frutas, verduras y carne).
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana L. contacted her neighbors and friends to form this commission in the neighborhood. Sra. Sebastiana has a small hamburger stand in the center of town. In the last few years she's had a considerable number of clients, but she continually tries to give them an enjoyable atmosphere in her business. She's anxious to have the opportunity to grow her business and increase her income. 

The committee calls itself "Mujeres Virtuosas", or "Virtuous Women", and has 15 members. They stand out in the community for being very united and having an entrepeneurial spirit. The ladies are asking for the credit for the purchase of edible merchadise for later sale, such as fruits, vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: Buying vegetables, fruits and meat

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Verónica, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe juntos a su esposo e hijo; él esposo labora actualmente como distribuidor de productos  y le apoyo con los gastos del  hogar.
 Labora para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo. Durante este tiempo con mucho esfuerzo va poco a poco construyendo su vivienda y ella quiere que le apoye con un financiamiento para la comprar de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, hierro entre otros materiales. contruir la pared de atras de la vivienda. 
Se siente muy contenta por el apoyo que recibe de Kiva atrávez de Afodenic  ya que su condición de vida va cambiando.
texts.en:
Verónica lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and son.  Her husband works as a products distributor and he helps her meet household expenses.  She has worked for a private firm for some time.  During this time with much effort and little by little she’s been building her house.  She wants a loan to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, gravel, concrete blocks and iron rods among other supplies to build a wall in the back part of her house.

She feels very happy because of the Kiva support she gets through Afodenic because her living conditions is changing.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro S. H., tiene 41 años está casado con la señora Lourdes juntos tienen 2 de hijos 9 y 3 años, son muy trabajadores y unidos pero actualmente la esposa esta delicada de salud ya que ha tenido un accidente, uno de sus ganados le dio un golpe mientras cargaba forraje y tienes problemas con la columna vertebral, viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la Maica sud. Su principal actividad del cliente es la producción de la leche cruda para su posterior venta a las señoras que se dedican a la elaboración de quesillo, actualmente cuentan con 12 cabezas de ganado lechero para realizar su actividad, el esposo también trabaja de taxista después de ayudar a ordeñar y alimentar al ganado sale a trabajar todos los días, para que de esa manera pueda incrementar a sus ingresos para el mejor sustento de su familia.

El préstamo es destinado para la compra de forraje (alimento balanceado) para la alimentación de su ganado, ya que existe una escasez de dicho forraje y  a la misma vez se ha incrementado el precio.

Entre sus sueños y metas es incrementar su ganado hasta tener una pequeña granja de por  lo menos 50 cabezas de ganado lechero , y  que sus dos hijos estudien una carrera profesional , para que de esta manera tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Genaro S. H. is 41 years old. He is married to Lourdes and has two children, aged 9 and 3 years old. They are a very hardworking and united family. Unfortunately, his wife is quite frail due to an accident, in which one of their cows kicked her while she was providing the animal feed. As a result, she has problems with her spinal column. They live in the town of Cochabamba in the Maica sud region. The bulk of their work involves providing dairy milk, which is then sold to local women who make quesillo (similar to cottage cheese). At present, Genaro and his family have 12 cows to provide the milk. Genaro also works as a taxi driver afterwards, in order to increase the family's income. 

The loan will be used to buy more feed (balanced diet) for his cows, since there is a shortage of such feed locally and the price of feed has also risen. 

Amongst the dreams and challenges he has, Genaro would like to build a small farm with at least 50 dairy cows. He also wants his children to study for a professional career and a better quality of life.

loans.use: Compra de forraje para su ganado lechero

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable, casado su esposa es comerciante, agricultor desde hace tiempo, inicio con el apoyo de sus padres fueron ellos que le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra. 
El principal problema que enfrenta es el alza de los insumos y productos agrícolas lo cuales requiere  para mantener y proteger al cultivo. Planes para su negocio es mejora los suelos de su finca con la incorporación de abonos. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y abonar su cultivo para que le rinda.
texts.en:
Orlando is a hard-working man, honest and responsible. He is married and his wife works as a merchant. He has been a farmer for a long time and started with the support of his parents. They taught him how to cultivate the land.

The main problem he faces is the price increase of agricultural inputs which he needs to maintain and protect his crop. His business plan is to improve the soil of his farm with the incorporation of fertilizers. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers to yield a better harvest.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar trabajador, casado, sus hijos estudian en la primaria, agricultor, su esposa le apoya con la comercialización de los productos de la cosecha,  inicio desde muy joven y con el apoyo de la esposa ya que es la que lo incentivaba para iniciar su negocio propio. Se le ha presentado dificultades con plagas y enfermedades pero se ha visto a tiempo y salvado la cosecha. 
Con el préstamo que solicitad comprara insecticida, fungicida, foliares y fertilizantes. Para obtener mejor calidad en su producto.
texts.en:
Oscar is a hard worker. He is married and has children who are in elementary school. His wife helps out by selling the products from their harvest. Oscar began farming as a young man and the support he received from his wife encouraged him to start his own business. The current challenges he faces are pests and diseases, but this time he was able to salvage his crops.

The loan he requested will be used to buy insecticides, fungicides, plant nutrients, and fertilizers. This will help him achieve a better quality product.

loans.use: Purchase insecticides, fungicides, plant nutrients, and fertilizers

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es:
Genaro casado, comerciante y agricultor el negocio es familiar ya que sus hijos le apoyan trabajan en el cultivo. Inicio con esfuerzo propio poco a poco mejorando su finca, tiene la necesidad de comprar de una yunta de bueyes para arrear la tierra y trasportar la producción siendo esto unos de sus planes para beneficio en mejorar su nivel de vida. 
El préstamo que solicitad será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes para obtener mejores productos y venderlo a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Genaro is married and works as a merchant and farmer in the family business. His children help by working in the fields. Genaro started through his own efforts and gradually made improvements to his farm. He needs to buy a yoke of oxen so that he can plow his land and transport his harvest. These are some of his plans so that he can improve his standard of living.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers so that he can obtain better quality crops that he can sell at a higher price.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: El señor Lino nacido el 10 de Diciembre  en Valle grande casado con la Sra. Ana  con 2 hijos ambos mayores, hoy viven en sombrerito trabajan en la agricultura junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  siembran arroz, maíz, también tienen una quinta de achachairu y plátano todo lo que cosechan sacan a vender al mercado de Santa Cruz, con el dinero del crédito desean comprar plantas cítricas para la siembra ya que vieron que hay mucha ganancias con estas plantas, como la naranja, mandarina, etc., el Sr. Lino es una persona muy trabajadora desde muy pequeño se dedico a esta actividad y ya tiene mucho conocimientos sobre la tierra y las plantas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Lino was born in the village 10 de Diciembre in the Grand Valley. He is married, and he and his wife Ana have two adult children. Now he lives in Sombrerito and works as a farmer alongside his wife and children. They grow rice, corn, acachairu ( a small fruit from the mangosteen family), and plantains. They plant and harvest all these crops and then bring them to the market in Santa Cruz. With the loan money they hope to buy citrus plants like oranges, mandarines, etc. to expand their farm. Mr. Lino is a very hardworking man, and he has worked in agriculture since he was a young boy. He has a great store of knowledge about soil and plants. He is thankful for the support offered by this institution.

loans.use: Purchase of citrus plants

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El Joven Julio  cliente que tiene un ciclo de antigüedad, este seria su segunda secuencia por el negocio que realiza se le invito a sacar un crédito individual ya que demostró ser responsable y puntual, considerando que es muy joven, puesto que cuenta con 21 años de edad y conoce muy bien su negocio el cual prácticamente es una herencia familiar, julio vive con su mamá y sus tres hermanos menores a quienes ayuda a mantener porque su padre falleció, tuvo que aprender este oficio desde muy joven  ya que la necesidad le obligo a asumir responsabilidades de jefe de hogar apoyándole a su mama el como todo joven tiene aspiraciones como  por ejemplo ampliar su taller y comprar maquinas bordadoras computarizadas y poner empleados, al momento el realiza los bordados de manera manual con una maquina bordadora eléctrica y su trabajo es muy minucioso  y requiere mucha concentración , también desea estudiar una carrera que le ayude a levantar esta pequeña empresa que esta forjando; por lo pronto con el dinero del crédito comprara una maquina bordadora que por ocasión le están ofreciendo y así esta creciendo su taller.
texts.en: Julio, who has already received a loan through the organization, was invited to take out a second individual loan because he has shown himself to be responsible and punctual with his payments. He is only 21 years old, but he knows his business very well since it is practically a family inheritance. He lives with his mother and three younger brothers who he supports because his father passed away at a young age. He learned his trade very young because he was forced to become the head of the household and support his mother. Like many young men he has many aspirations. He hopes to build a bigger shop and purchase computerized embroidery machines and hire employees. Currently he does all the embroidery by hand with an electric sewing machine and the work is very meticulous and requires total concentration. He also hopes to earn a degree that will help him lift up this small business that he is building. With the current loan he will buy a embroidery machine that is for sale and thus grow his shop.

loans.use: Purchase of embroidering machines

loans.name: Geny

texts.es:
La Sra. Geny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín . Es soltera, tiene 44 años y no tiene hijos.
	
Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar y motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de Venta de Cosméticos, obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio, ya que en cada campaña ofrece sus productos de belleza a sus amistades. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde ofrece y recibe a sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa de alcanzar poco a poco sus metas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00, comprará  mas productos de belleza, para tenerlos en stock como: colonias, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes y cremas para damas y caballeros, lápiz labiales y para contornos de ojos , polvos compactos,  y otros productos  mas, todo esto para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Geny, se siente muy feliz del negocio que realiza y esta muy agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que brindan a mujeres que quieren salir adelante,  espera que sigan así siempre y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Geny is a member of the “Esmeralda” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province, in San Martín department.  She is single, 44 years old, and doesn't have any children.

Faced with the need to make income for her household and through her own motivation, Geny set up her small business selling cosmetics.  She has obtained very good results from her business from the beginning since, during each sales season, she offers her beauty products for sale to her friends.  Her business is located in her home, in a well-equipped space where she offers her products for sale and greets her customers.  She is currently continuing in the same business and is very proud that she is gradually achieving her goals.

Geny will use this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more beauty products to have in stock such as colognes, perfumes, talcum powders, deodorants, ladies' and men's creams, lip sticks, eye liners, powder compacts and other products.  She will buy all these products to keep her customers happy.

Geny feels very happy with her business and she is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support that they provide to women who want to get ahead in life.  She hopes that they continue doing this forever and that they help many families and enterprising women.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to increase her stock

loans.name: Shirley Antuanet

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Las Monicas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace dos años, ella  siembra limón en  terreno de cultivo que es herencia de sus padres, ella cosecha el limón semanalmente, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre es que ella ha ganado experiencia en este negocio.

Shirley desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha y calidad en su fruto. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Shirley es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Shirley is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the rural Las Monicas settlement, located in the Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area that is located in the Piura province in the region of the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Shirley has been farming for 2 years.  She cultivates lemons on land that she inherited from her parents.  She harvests the lemons on a weekly basis.  Thanks to the teachings of her father, she has become experienced in this type of business.

Shirley wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her lemon crops.  In this way, she hopes to have a better harvest and better quality fruit.  To do this, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Shirley is a quite calm and responsible person.  Her main desire is to be able to grow as a businesswoman and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
La Sra. Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 52 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le caracterizo y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo D. negocio. Poco a poco fue ganando experiencia, confianza y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.
Con lo que actualmente logro con clientela fija; amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar, donD. allí encuentran todo lo necesario que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atienD. con el carisma y simpatía que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos D. productos como: leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras D. la zona, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Yrma, como le dicen D. cariño está contenta con su la actividad que realiza día a día. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Yrma belongs to the communal bank "Esmeralda," in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martin.  She is 52 years old, single, and is the mother of 2 children who are still dependent upon her.

She has always been characterized by her fighting spirit and her strong desire to get ahead through her own means, which led her to start her own business selling groceries.  She tells us that she has been running this type of business for a number of years.  Over time she gradually gained experience and confidence and became well known and liked by her customers.

Now she has a regular customer base maD. up of friends from the neighborhood, area residents and neighbors who come to her store daily to buy.  There they find everything that a housewife needs, and she personally attends to them with her characteristic charm and friendliness.

With this loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy a variety of products such as: milk, canned fish, a variety of brands of oats in packets, different flavors of tea (chamomile and anise), local vegetables from the area, household cleaning and personal hygiene products, to proviD. better service to her customers.

Yrma, as they call her affectionately, is content with the activities she carries out each day.  She is also grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: she will buy groceries to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.
Teresa de Jesús, es una mujer trabajadora, que ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico en su hogar y motivada por su esposo, emprendieron su negocio de venta de materiales agregados, que son materiales especialmente para construir casas y edificios, iniciándose para esto con un capital de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus materiales y la buena atención a sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  de la venta de agregados, hoy en día alquilo un local mas grande y seguro, donde poner sus materiales, así de esta manera afrecer un buen servicio y atención a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  materiales agregados como:                       Arena y ripio fino y grueso, bloquetas, arena de calle y tierra negra, piedras chancadas. También realiza servicio de desmontes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual a su personal. 
Teresita, se siente muy contenta con el negocio y trabajo que realiza día a día. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante y ser grandes empresarias.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the communal bank "Esmeralda," located in the department of San Martín, Peru. She is 41 years old, married and has one son who she cares for.  Teresa is a hard worker. In facing the need to have an income, with encouragement from her husband they started a business selling construction materials specifically for building houses and other buildings. They began with a capital of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles (361.00 USD). Since that time, they have had good results thanks to the quality of their materials and their excellent customer service. 

Currently, Teresa continues to run her business selling construction materials. She now rents a larger and more secure space where she stores her materials. In this way she is able to offer quality service and tend to her clients. With this loan of $1,100 she plans to buy construction supplies She also provides land clearing services. Part of the loan will also be put towards paying her staff each month.  Teresa is very happy with her business and the work that she does. She is grateful to her communal bank Manuela Ramos, for supporting her and people like her who want to work and succeed as well as become great entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for houses and other buildings

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La Sra. Magda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 58 años y 4 hijos todos independientes.

Magda, se dedica a la venta de mercadería de ropas de segunda mano y cosméticos de la línea Unique. Por lo que cuenta con  clientes fijos que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. También va de casa en casa, a ofrecer sus productos de belleza a sus amistades más cercanas, que son clientes seguros y no la dejan mal. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado, ya que genera sus propios ingresos mensuales, que lo utiliza para cancelar sus cuotas mensuales de su banquito. Magda, con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo es una mujer emprendedora y a su edad se siente capaz de seguir realizando, muchos sueños aun.
Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas en fardos como: pantalones en diferentes colores, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para damas, caballeros y  niños. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando productos de belleza, para aumentar su stock y ofrecer a sus clientes.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria,  asimismo con un Micro seguro que me da tranquilidad ante un siniestro inesperado que pueda sucederme así mis hijos no se quedaran sin apoyo y alienta a otras mujeres a pertenecer a los BC y así poder contar con este producto por la minina suma de un nuevo sol.
texts.en:
Magda belongs to the communal bank "Esmeralda," in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martin. She is 58 years old, single, and has four independent children.

Magda has a business selling second-hand clothing and cosmetics from the Unique line.  She has a regular base of customers who know her and know of her business.  She also sells door-to-door, offering her beauty products to friends who live nearby, who are reliable customers and with whom she keeps a good relationship.  Her strength and perseverance helped her to grow as an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has achieved, since she generates her own monthly income, which she uses to make her monthly payments to her communal bank.  Magda, with her dedication and effort, is an enterprising woman who, at her age, feels capable of continuing to realize her dreams.  

With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy bales of clothing for women, men and children such as: different colors of pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses in all sizes and models, polo shirts and dresses.  She will also invest part of the money in beauty products, to increase her inventories and her offerings to her customers.

She says "I am grateful for the opportunity that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization is offering me through the loans that will help me to develop as a woman and small businesswoman.  In addition, the "Micro" (life) insurance the organization offers gives me peace of mind since if anything unexpected happened to me my children would not be left without support, and this also encourages other women to join the organization so that they can access this product for the minimal sum of one Peruvian sol.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Victoria Lili

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las afueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5:00pm. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. También brinda pensión al medio día, a sus clientes fijos (Estudiantes) de lunes a domingos. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y  pensionistas.

Viki, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día , y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank “Esmeralda”, in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner. She is 37 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are dependents and are studying.

Victoria has always been characterized by her fighting spirit and her desire to move forward. This is what led her to start her own business of selling kebabs outside her house. Little by little she has become well known among her customers and today she tells us that she is doing very well in this business. She makes her sales daily from 5:00 pm on. She has been working in this business many years and she is very happy with what she has made. She also offers accommodations at mid-day for her regular clients (students) Mondays through Sundays.
 
With this loan of S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy ingredients such as sacks of rice, eggs, native chickens for her juanes (rice with chicken), and gutted chickens for her kebabs, also cooking utensils to offer quality service to her customers and lodgers. 

Viki, as she is commonly known, feels very proud of the work that she does every day and gives thanks to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her food.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Like most married men, Hussein works hard to do his best for his wife and little kid. Hussein is a hard working 27-year-old owner of a small restaurant in Bint Jbeil, where he has served fast food since 2008. His food is tasty according to most of his clients. He is a man who seeks perfection and customer service is his major success point. 

Hussein is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the third time in order to build a brick tent in front of his restaurant to provide more space and increase the number of customers attending. He has been a good standing borrower and hopes to open a big famous restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To build a brick tent in front of his restaurant for more space

loans.name: Maria Erma

texts.es:
La señora Maria Erma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene  39 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva varios años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad, cuenta con 16 motokares, las cuales cada motokar  tiene un personal, que lo hace trabajar a diario.  Maria Erma, recibe  un ingreso de 350.00 nuevos soles diariamente.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Maria Erma, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Maria Erma belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of the San Martin Province within the Department of San Martin. She is 39 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of two children who are students and are still her dependents.

She has worked for many years providing urban transportation services in her motorcar. Her husband is responsible for going to different places in the city. She has 16 motorcars, each of which has a driver who works daily. Maria Erma earns 350 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) each day.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase spare parts and oils such as lubricants, steering wheel hubs, and spark plugs in order to provide better service and tend to the customers much better. Today, she is an independent woman and it is her and her husband who make the decisions and manage their business.

Maria Erma tells us that belonging to a women’s group has helped her to better know her rights and together, they make themselves respected. She is grateful for Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to begin in the area of business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and oils to improve her service

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La Sra. Adith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Proceres”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

La necesidad D. sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella deciD. iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. animales vivos (Cuyes, conejos y gallinas), criadas en su propia casa. Con su primer crédito  D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles fue implementando poco a poco un local, para la crianza D. sus animales,  posteriormente fue comprando sus animales, estos reproducieron y fueron aumentando mensualmente. Ahora es muy conocida por sus clientes y conocen el negocio que realiza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará, huevos para hacer poner a sus gallinas, alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres D. cualquier enfermedad.

Adith, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, para alimentar a sus animales, cree que vale el sacrificio que está haciendo día a día. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  muchas mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adith belongs to the “Los Proceres” community bank, Tarapoto district, San Martin province, department of San Martín. She is married, 62 years old and the mother of 5 children, all on their own. 

Due to the need to get her children ahead and thanks to her enterprising spirit and energy, she decided to open her own business selling live animals (guinea pigs, rabbits and hens) raised in her own home. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles she outfitted her locale to raise animals little by little. The animals reproduced and grew every month. Now she is very well known to her customers and they know her business.  

With this loan of S/1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy eggs to make her hens lay, and balanced feed and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free of disease.  

Adith is very satisfied with the job she does, despite the work being hard and having to get up early to feed her animals. She believes that the sacrifice she is making day to day is worth it.  She is also grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering support to her and to many women who want to get ahead.

loans.use: She will buy animals (guinea pigs, rabbits and hens)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for his business

loans.name: Merardo

texts.es:
Merardo tiene 45 años y reside junto con su esposa en su casa propia en el caserío La Pilca, una zona rural en el distrito de Olmos en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Merardo se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su Mototaxi. Lleva seis años realizando su negocio en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Merardo desea utilizar el préstamo para mantener su mototaxi en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. También desea hacer unos arreglos en su domicilio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Merardo is 45 years old and lives with his wife in their own home in the community of La Pilca, a rural area in the district of Olmos in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Merardo works offering a passenger transportation service in his motorcycle taxi. He has been doing this for six years, running his route between Olmos and its district. He has established customers in the area.  

Merardo wants to use the loan to maintain his motor cycle taxi in good condition and to continue offering a good service. He also wants to make some repairs in his home to improve his family's quality of life. For this he has decided it best to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre de 01 hijo. 

Elizabeth, su seguridad y perseverancia le llevo a iniciar  su propio negocio de venta de refrigerios, ubicada en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, frente al Centro de Salud de su Distrito, para brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. Lleva varios años en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores del barrio y amigos conocidos, que saben de su buena sazón e higiene en la elaboración de sus productos, a quienes  ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará: insumos como arroz, harina, huevos, mantequilla, leche, panes, pollos, y otros para la preparación de chaufas, empanadas, sanguches, cutachos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de frutas de la región  para la preparación de sus jugos y refrescos. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “Los Próceres” community bank, distrito of Tarapoto, province of San Martín and departament of San Martín. She is married, 47 years old and the mother of 1 child.   

Her confidence and perserverance led Elizabeth to open her own business selling snacks. Her business is located in a well equipped place across from the District Health Center, and she offers her customers good service. She has been in the business for several years and is very happy with what she has accomplished, since it is going very well for her.  

Presently, she has faithful customers who are mainly residents of the neighborhood and freinds of hers. They know she is a good cook and that she prepares her products sanitarily. She serves them with the charisma and friendliness that characterizes her. 

With this loan of de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy: rice, flour, eggs, butter, milk, bread, chicken and more to prepare fied rice, empanadas, sandwiches and cutachos. Part of the money will also be invested in buying regional fruit to prepare juices and drinks.

She is ready for all of this and with strength to keep on working and get ahead. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to her achieving her dreams and goals.

loans.use: She will buy imgredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa es una viuda de 29 años. Tiene dos hijos y vive en su casa propia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino en su domicilio. Ella tiene actualmente 15 ovinos y aves de corral. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo, las ofrece en venta a los negociantes y su clientela establecida en el mercado local. Aprendió la crianza de estos animales de su madre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. 

Rosa desea usar el crédito para adquirir alimentos balanceados así también pastos para sus animales y también para arreglar su corral. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 29 year old widow. She lives with her two children in her own house in the District of Tambogrande. This is a farming zone in the Piura Region, four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque Region.
